Last weeks "Swing at the Abbey" was a blast! We have more of the same this Monday!

If you're at a loose end after work, join us (from about 5:30pm) for a bite to eat at our "Swing Time Supper Club" and take advantage of the happy hour from 5pm - 8pm!

We still bring you two totally awesome swing dance classes. Balboa with Paul Crook & Natasha Hall and Lindy Hop with Sean Hall & Lucy Toseland.

If you are NEW to Swing dancing, or maybe an experienced dancer, come on down, all levels are welcome, you'll be sure to pick up some fantastic moves and some great authentic styling.

Balboa & Lindy Hop classes run simultaneously.

Beginners Lindy Hop & Balboa - 7:30pm - 8:10pm

10 min break - Get the drinks in! It's HAPPY HOUR!

Intermediate Lindy Hop & Balboa - 8:20pm - 9pm

--
POLITE NOTICE:

PLEASE DON'T TURN UP BEFORE 9PM AND TRY TO PAY £4 FOR THE SOCIAL DANCE!

IF CLASSES ARE RUNNING THAT MEANS OUR TEACHERS ARE WORKING AND SHARING THEIR EXPERT KNOWLEDGE, SO ENTRY IS £8.00!

THE BAR IS NICE UPSTAIRS, RELAX AND GET A DRINK, THEN SEE US AFTER 9PM.

SORRY, THERE IS NO FREE ENTRY FOR SPECTATORS!
--

From 9pm - 11pm it's social dance time. DJ Tim Hellzapoppin will be playing a good mix of Swing & R&B tunes to get the dance floor jumpin', so you'll be able to practice your moves from the classes.


Doors open at 7pm

Admission:

£8.00 - for both classes & club (before 9pm)

£4.00 - club (after 9pm)

Hope to see you! ; )

"The Vintage Dance Night. Lindy Hop, Balboa, Shag"

1374358439491429.description:
Welcome to Property Investor Africa - the No.1 On-line Marketplace for Property Investments in Africa (PiA). 

With a huge housing deficit and  lack of financial investment in Africa's real estate industry, PiA aims to bring financial and institutional investors, property developers, governments, banks, fund managers and businesses in the supply chain together, on one single platform.

Property Investor Africa Summit 2014, to be held on 7 June 2014 at Ravensbourne, guarantees leading information from across the African real estate sector as well as local market intelligence from industry experts. 

The full-day conference, themed Investing in Africa, features distinguished leaders and policy-makers from the EU, Africa, Asia and the Middle East, who will analyse the prospects of the African emerging economy. A key focus area is the recent proven discovery of oil and gas, as well as Africa's formalising banking sector.

Invited Keynote speakers include Elisabeth Troni - Executive Director at UBS; Tutu Agyare - Non-Executive Director of Tullow Oil plc and Managing Partner at Nubuke Investments; TidjaneThiam - CEO of Prudential Plc; Bob Diamond - former CEO of Barclays; Lord Sheikh - House of Lords; Lord Boateng - House of Lords; Samuel Esson Jonah - CEO of Jonah Capital, and many other global business leaders. 

Main topics explored include Energy Efficiency in Africa's Property Industry, How the Oil Boom will Change Africa's Property Market, and Opportunities in Africa's Banking Sector Real Estate.

The conference rooms, VIP round table discussion groups and exhibition area are in close proximity, giving the exhibitors excellent opportunity to meet the participants. VIP Coffee will be served in the exhibition area. 

It is with pleasure that we invite your company and organizations to take an active part in the PiA Summit as Corporate Partners, VIP B2B host, Seminar Presenter or Exhibitor, to promote your brand equity through this prestigious international platform. Your involvement in the conference is of utmost importance to us. We will work hard to increase your visibility and return on investment before, during and after the conference.

Together, let us make this conference a memorable and successful one.

Register TODAY at    https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/property-investor-africa-summit-2014-tickets-10646607289?ref=estw

Ads: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WH5lIGpboOM&feature=youtu.be

1000 Available Spaces

General Admission: Free by Registration @ www.piasummit.com

For registration and questions contact our Event Team:
T: +44 207 183 4411

E: events@propertyinvestorafrica.com

 For more information about Property Investor Africa Summit, please visit: http://piasummit.com

We join Vinyl club at Ground 281 for a special live stream!

The concept is to invite new and undiscovered talent to showcase their music, exchange records, guide them on technical skills and invite well known DJ's to come and show others how they perform. There will also be talks and presentations from different areas in the music industry, and guidance on many subjects, from how to put you music out there, starting a label, producing tips, marketing, branding yourself as an artist, and other subjects in the music industry.

This will be a great opportunity to create a community of similar minded DJs, artists, producers and generally music lovers, and to provide a meeting point to help people network with other musicia

Weekly show celebrating what's on and who's inspiring London.

1395032234101492.description:
Random Magic pres. Cajmere Vs Green Velvet (Cajual X Relief) UK EXCLUSIVE + Boddika / Luke Solomon b2b Neville Watson (Classic Music Company)
Farr Festival X Random Magic. South London Ordnance / October / Otto & Farr Residents

TICKETS
RSN: http://bit.ly/1oIybpy
Fire : http://bit.ly/randommagicFIRE
Resident Advisor :  http://bit.ly/1ctFBwE
  
Saturday 3rd May 2014 | 10pm - 7am 
FIRE, South Lambeth Rd, London SW8 1RT  
_____________________
 
RANDOM MAGIC steps out of the shadows and into the Spring-time for the second night in their series of music, magic and dancing taking place over the May Bank Holiday at FIRE.
  
This time they bring something rather special as they conjure up a UK exclusive with house don CAJMERE performing back to back with his own alias GREEN VELVET. Change has been a constant theme throughout the successful career of Curtis Alan Jones, but as he's crossed genres, explored themes from the comedic to the serious and changed monikers, the common thread running through the music he has made for nearly two decades and both his Cajual and Relief labels is its roots in and dedication to the Chicago House sound. For this very special appearance Curtis will be donning both of his hats and performing two special sets. Think lots of smoke and green lights and some rather stunning music.
 
Also in FIRE's main room will be Nonplus label head BODDIKA. With incredible collaborations between himself and Joy Orbsion, one half of the highly respected Instra:mental, one third of Autonomic and solo as Boddika, these past few years have marked Al Green out as one of the UK club music's most restless innovators.
 
The Classic Recording Company's leader LUKE SOLOMON and the amazing musical mind that is NEVILLE WATSON play back to back, warming this room to perfection. Luke returns to Random Magic after a spell-binding performance at Halloween to play an extended set with Neville Watson, the master of revivalist house.  

Taking over the second room of FIRE will be FARR FESTIVAL. Just 5 years young Farr has grown into one of the most well-respected boutique festivals in the country. With this year's festival stepping up a gear this will be the London launch for the festival. For the celebrations they'll be bringing with them Hot Flush's SOUTH LONDON ORDNANCE who has made musical waves with his Swamp 81-esque percussive house and techno sounds and Stockholm's OCTOBER from SKUDGE Records. In support will be OTTO & FARR RESIDENTS.
  
Random Magic's last event back in October saw the likes of Omar S, Maxxi Soundsystem, Horse Meat Disco, Luke Solomon, Honey Dijon (Live) put the Funktion 1 Sound System to the test.  Taking the spring solstice, morris dancers and maypoles as inspiration for this party, Random Magic is back to wow with more sporadic gatherings and late night happenings. 

www.randommagic.co.uk 
www.firelondon.net
www.magicandmedicine.com

1397372373860367.description:
When the Equinox lands this Thursday the 20th of March, you have the opportunity to make a real difference to the lives of innocent animals by protesting the capture and slaughter of dolphins that is an atrocious annual tradition in Japan’s Taiji Cove. 

The little cove’s dirty great secret was uncovered in 2003, when marine conservation society Sea Shepherd released images of the now infamous ‘bloody cove’ – revealing the epicentre of the annual murder of 20 000 dolphins, porpoises and small whales which occurs in Japan every year between September and March. Since 2010 Sea Shepherd has maintained an ongoing presence of volunteers standing watch on the Cove site, known as The Cove Guardians. 

Australian Cove Guardian Emillie describes the scene she witnessed at Taiji Cove…

“A pod of 250 bottlenose dolphins spent days netted in the cove while their family unit was torturously torn apart. Dolphins deemed worthy for a life of captivity were stolen away. The remainder waited - disoriented, frightened and hungry until the eventual slaughter. On an almost daily basis I continued to witness intelligent, wild and free dolphin pods systematically driven into the cove only to depart as a commodity, either as a petrified prisoner or lifeless meat for human consumption. Every day, six months of the year, this is the reality of Taiji. And it is a visibly decaying town, symbolic of its archaic practices.”

The Japanese government maintain that Taiji is part of a cultural tradition, and yet the evidence is clear that this is a commercially driven endeavour, with the animals ending up in captivity, on the food market, or simply left injured in the oceans to die. Unlike whales, dolphins do not have an international organisation to offer them protection, so it really is down to us - the people of the international community to care enough to take action for these animals which scientists are increasingly discovering to be highly intelligent, emotional and social beings. 

Momentum is building rapidly for the opposition of dolphin and whale slaughter and capture in the form of global protests, a viral storm of Internet activity and media coverage including high profile documentaries. In 2009 the Academy Award winning documentary The Cove was released, featuring Richard O’Barry, a former dolphin capturer and trainer for the TV Series Flipper, who later dedicated his life to preventing the very same practice. The impact of this film now looks set to be matched by the recent release of the documentary Blackfish, which chillingly reveals the immorality and tragic consequences of keeping orca whales in captivity. 

Continued pressure is crucial. This Equinox Protest will act as a follow up to the extremely successful protest event of February 20th, during which over 1000 people arrived outside the Japanese embassy to show their derision at the Japanese government’s continued support of the annual slaughter. 

The world is waking up to the horrific reality of Taiji cove, but nothing will change unless we turn our awareness into action. Please join us at the protest on March 20th, to show Japan and the world that we no longer accept this and bring about a change desperately overdue.
1397372373860367.name: London Protest against Taiji Annual Dolphin Hunt & Captivity -  20th MARCH 2014

1400544033543172.description:
Introduction to Sociocracy (a.k.a Dynamic governance) London, UK
21st & 22nd June 2014 ~ with recommended 3rd day of practice to embodying learning ~ 23rd June

Discover Sociocracy ~ the elegant and effective way to dynamically manage organisation ~ with James Priest, supported by Rakesh "Rootsman Rak"

This 2-day workshop, with an optional 3rd day for guided experiential practice, will give you an overview of the main elements of Sociocracy. You’ll understand why Sociocracy is so effective in helping organisations become more sustainable and dynamic, and you'll develop transferable skills you can apply within your groups, organisations and relationships!

About the facilitators:

James Priest combines 18 years experience of project management with over a decade supporting intentional communities, organisations and individuals to thrive.  An advocate of transformational tools and methods facilitating self-fulfillment, more conscious relationships and collaborative organisation, his current synthesis of approach includes well known tools such as Sociocracy, Non Violent Communication, Way of Council, Inner Voice Dialogue and the Psychology of Selves.

In addition to his services as a holistic organisational development consultant, James provides facilitation and training for community groups and organisations, sharing his passion for exploring and understanding the subtle energetic dimensions of relationship and organisational systems. Working as a skilled Voice Dialogue facilitator, he also has a private practice for individuals and couples.

Website: www.thriveincommunity.co.uk

Rakesh Rootsman Rak
Rakesh is an  experienced low impact living designer and teacher from the UK, specialising in community resilience, permaculture, creating food forests and low maintenance food growing systems. He has worked as an advisor to several community projects in London and throughout Europe and has taught in many countries around the world. Rakesh has turned his dyslexia to his advantage by developing a talent for observation and hands on learning and teaching methods. At a young age he established a successful computer consultancy and, after achieving financial independence, acquired skills as a homeopath and yoga teacher which he put to use in Ananda Marga humanitarian relief projects in Africa, Asia and Eastern Europe. Along with Permaculture Rakesh focuses on the human skills of communication and planning so necessary for successful communities.

Website: www.ecologicaldesigns.co.uk

Dates
Introduction Sat 21st and Sun 22nd June 2014, from 9:30am to 5:30pm
Optional deepening the process day Mon 23rd June 2014

Venue
The 2 day introduction will take place at an alternative school in East London (5 mins walk from a tube station). Full details will be given on application.
The one day deepening session will take place in Ilford (we have a choice of venues depending on the number of attendees). All venues are within 5 to 10 mins walk from a British Rail station, which is 15 minutes from Liverpool street or Stratford station.

Cost
£150 advanced discount (if paid before 1st May)
£200 full cost
£300 if you are funded
£390 for a group discount of 3 people if paid before 1st May
£500 for a group discount of 4 people if paid before 1st May

Food
Tea and snacks will be provided for the breaks. To show the abundance of community action, we kindly request people to bring food and drinks to share for lunch. Please bring something vegetarian that is easy to split and share with the group. It could be your favourite home made dish or something store bought. If everyone brings enough to feed 2 people, we will show the power of community in action by sharing the load and creating abundance for all. Ideally the food you bring will tell a story, and become part of the learning experience.

Contact
Rakesh rakeshaji@gmail.com

Sign up
To register for this course please fill in this very short and very simple form
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1iq22aG-WDhm4QY--uDVYmjYc8jS0D4Kw1TVvrqWCfpE/viewform


Feedback from previous courses

The Sociocratic method offers a whole system governance solution to draw on the collective intelligence of any organisation or group. It facilitates collaborative innovation, fosters transparency and guarantees the potential for equivalence in decision making.  "The practical nature of Sociocracy, as experienced in the workshop filled me with inspiration. I've often felt powerless and before the workshop I had the strong feeling “there has to be a better way”.  After the workshop I felt, “yes, I am starting to get my groove back”. 
Eileen, Independent Translator and Copywriter

"This was not an easy workshop, with  the steep learning curve of Sociocratic process and a two year old conflict waiting to be resolved, battling for supremacy… The facilitators art was such we learned the processes while in process! We never lost a member to boredom, ( much) or from the room, (for long) in the two long days of  the workshop." 
Roz - Co-housing resident - UK

Although I had read the book “We the people” twice and already had done some practical work with Sociocracy the course gave me a much deeper understanding of  how Sociocracy integrates human wisdom, natural organizational design and how this is realised by the Sociocracy principles and practices. Understanding the purpose and intent behind the principles will make me able to adapt practices and handle challenging situations. Now I am really exited to facilitate and implement Sociocracy on a new level." 
Michael Gothe - Agile Coach, Stockholm

"I didn’t know anything about Sociocracy before hand. The course presented a good overview and it was easy to grasp the effectiveness of the method. I’m active in Transition Gothenburg and I will support every initiative to introduce Sociokrati in our network." 
Susanne - Transition Gothenburg

"Thank you for a great weekend. You presented outstanding material in a personal, present and powerful way. I came back with many tools to get started implementing Sociocracy."
Matteas - RAW & Green Earth, Stockholm

"This workshop gave me a deeper appreciation for the sociocratic principles and values. I felt fully engaged, had lot of fun, learned a lot, and received much value from the interactions with the instructor and the other participants. I particularly appreciated the focus on experiential learning. I highly recommend this workshop for anyone who wants to improve their understanding of sociocracy!"
Jan  - Global Process Improvement Manager, ABB, Sweden

1404256469816299.description:
In 2012 The London Community Gospel Choir went to Barcelona to team up with that city’s Latin Big Band, and musical director/arranger Ramon Escalé, for a dynamic makeover of some of their repertoire into a brassy, Latin format. The power and technique of the choir linked with the syncopation of salsa to create an uplifting live show.

Tonight in a special La Linea event the Choir perform with a big band, led by Cuban virtuoso violinist Omar Puente, to inject some Havana heat into their tunes and to bring their vocal power to some Cuban repertoire.

Energetic, professional, inspiring and spirit filled, whatever word you choose to describe London Community Gospel Choir there ‘ain’t no stopping them now’.

From the Choir’s humble beginnings in 1982 as Britain’s first concert gospel choir to performing at Wembley for the FA Cup final, The London Community Gospel Choir have grown to be world-wide phenomenon.

Renowned for their funky gospel flair, swing-beat, RnB traditional and soulful arrangements, invigorating choreography and vocal gymnastics, this dynamic group have performed at Live 8, Glastonbury and on the soundtrack for the Disney Smash the Lion King.

Tickets £20 plus booking fee

1405475179704070.description:
STUDIO 54 Night – Dj Ronny Birthday party v Duplexu Praha 12.4.2014 + star DJ LEE DAGGER (London)

Studio 54 vás zve na narozenivou party Dj RONNYho na sobotu 12.4.2014 s hvězdným hostem z Londýna DJ LEE DAGGER! 
Support Djs: Tommy Rogers a Enrico. 

Oslavenec Dj Ronny hraje od roku 1995 a to znamená, že brázdí okolo djského pultu již 19 let :). Roman Fojtík aka dj Ronny je dlouletý rezident Studia 54 a je oblíbený jak u nás, tak jeho djské úspěchy sahají až za hranice našich země.   
Mezi jeho největší úspěchy patří rok 2011 když ho oslovil holandský booking a jeho djský kalendář se začal plnit místy jako je Amsterdam, Hamburk nebo Paříž. Mezi nejprestižnější akce, na kterých si DJ Ronny zahrál patří i česká zastávka turné Home Of La Troya, která je považována za jednu z nejlepší nocí na Ibize, dále jeho dnes již legendární vystoupení jako předskokan skupiny Scooter před 8.000 lidmi, dále hraní v rakouských klubech sítě Nachtschicht ve Vídni, Linzi nebo Grazu a u nás doma si zahrál na velkých festivalech jako je Mácháč, Cosmic Trip nebo Pleasure Island. A tak bychom mohli pokračovat dál a dál (více info na www.djronny.cz).
Dj Ronny hraje house a progressive house a svůj narozeninový set předvede v sobotu 12.4.2014 v Duplexu. 

Hlavním dárkem od Studia 54 je londýnský star dj LEE DAGGER. Tento celosvětově oblíbený dj a remixér, byl 4 x za sebou nominovaný v kategorii “Nejlepší remixér” na nejprestižnější hudební konferenci světa WinterMusicConferenc v Miami. Byl v nominaci se super star djema jako jsou Avicii, Afrojack, Calvin Harris, Hardwell, Tommy Trash, R3hab a Kaskade. Tyhle všechny jména Lee Daggera řadí mezi star dje a není o tom pochyb! Letos již po 3 tí Lee vystoupil v Sydney v Austrálii na "Mardi Gras Party" pro 17.000 party people a to společně s Carl Coxe, David Guetta, George Michael, Kylie Minogue nebo Kelly Rowland. Není tajemstvím, že Lee Dagger má momentálně před vydáním nového alba “Bimbo Jones“ a tak se můžeme těšit na new music!  
(více info na www.leedagger.com)

Dalším gratulantem a rezidentem Studia 54 je Dj Tommy Rogers, který si mezi hraním v Miami USA, Švýcarsku nebo Francii “odskočí“ do domácího Duplexu a svým setem popřeje Ronnymu a oslaví tak jeho narozeniny. 
(více info na www.djtommyrogers.com)

A čtvrtým gratulantem a nejdéle hrajícím rezidentem Studia 54 je Dj Enrico.
Jeho hraní v nekolikrát oficiálně zvoleném nejlepším klubu světa Amnesia Ibiza mluví za vše a u nás v ČR není větší akce na které by nehrál. Na oslavu narozenin Dj Ronnyho si nachystal speciální  "Naked" narozeninový mix, tak se máte na co těšit! 
(více info na www.djenrico.cz)  

Sečteno podtrženo. DJs Lee Dagger, Ronny, Tommy Rogers a Enrico vystoupí na narozenivové oslavě Dj Ronny v sobotu 12.4.2014 v pražském klubu DUPLEX.


Oficiální afterparty bude ve Studiu 54. 


www.studio54.cz


More info is coming soon.

1405963452992454.description:
OXIDE & NEUTRINO - FAT SANDWICH - PAPA B & ZICO
THE SNEAK EAZIES      -      PLAYHEAD      -     MUTTLEY
ARIES        -        FLASH HARRY        -       AMBASSADOR

From the creators of Bambi Legs ( Bristol ) & TruSoundTribe ( London ) comes a brand new musical extravaganza. 
Dedicated to providing feel good, pout worthy, party music to the masses. In a totally immersible, Old Skool DIY fashion & stylee.
Thumper strives to break the divide between electronic & live acts. Showcasing some of the freshest underground talents alongside long time veterans of the industry. 
From knees up horn driven Ska, Dub & Roots to cheeky tail feather shaking garage, Breaks & Jungle!
As long as it feels great then we are game. 
Come reminisce to some old fatties while being introduced to a new generation of talent.


****ELECTRONIC****


OXIDE & NEUTRINO

are a DJ and MC duo from London.
 They both started out at the age of 16 on a pirate radio station called SUPREME FM, It was there they joined So Solid Crew and then formed DELIGHT FM.
 After two years of hype on the underground scene and selling more than 20,000 white labels they finally released their single
"Bound 4 Da Reload" which went to number 1 in the UK singles charts in May 2000 selling more than 200,000 copies. "Bound 4 Da Reload" was famously known for sampling the theme song to the BBC's hospital drama series, Casualty.
 They then went on to cover the prodigy's start the dance.
"No Good 4 Me" which featured Mega Man, Romeo and Lisa Maffia was released in December 2000 it reached number 6 in the Christmas singles charts and also sold over 200,000 copies.
https://soundcloud.com/djoxide/sets/oxide-neutrino/

PAPA B & ZICO

Zico is best known as a member of London's heavyweight reggae band onlyjoe. 
https://soundcloud.com/nuffruffriddims/setting-the-vibe-snippet

Papa B is a man of many talents.
Saxophonist, selecta, label manager & producer. Pappa B
represents for Maggie Scratchers, Hundred Years, Unit 137 & Onlyjoe
https://soundcloud.com/recreouk/papa-b-minimix

ARIES

One of jungle / drum and bass's rising stars, dj and producer Aries has been making big waves in the scene ever since his first release's in 2005. Closely associated with the Co-Lab Recordings camp (run by Benny Co-Lab and Heist), Chopstick Dubplate and Reggae Crew Friendly Fire, Aries looks set to fly the flag for the future sound of dubwise dnb. Touring and receiving huge support wordldwide and with a new project (LionFire) soon to drop on Dread Recordings, Aries is definitely one to keep your eye on.
https://soundcloud.com/aries-uk

MUTTLEY

With his debut release on 'Imperial Audio' reaching the top ten in Juno's Dubstep charts and a track on Jman's album (Greasy Vinyl), 2014 is set to be another busy year. Some of the DJ's supporting his sound include DJ Chef (Rinse Fm), Ruckspin, Skream (BBC), Diplo (Mad Decent), Plastician (Rinse Fm) and RSD (Smith and Mighty) to name a few. This year he has played at some of Bristols most popular nights such as 5127 and Shapes as well as his first headline shows in Europe; appearing on lineups alongside MJ Cole, Yasmin, N-Type, NYTA, Kode9, DJ Q, Fantastic Mr. Fox and more. Last year he also started the collective / label “Vivid Sounds”,  you can hear him playing live on Dusk.fm (first Monday of each month 4-6pm) and on Rood.fm (second and fourth Monday of each month 4-6pm).
https://soundcloud.com/muttleyuk

FLASH HARRY

Resident DJ for Sika Studios and T.F.I.F.
Flash Harry is a mash up DJ from the Midlands(UK).

From hip-hop beginnings, Flash only 24 has evolved in the past ten years, using his DJ skills and unique mashup style that consists of Reggae, Hip Hop, Funk, Breaks, House, Dubstep, Jungle DnB + many other genres to make sure he hits any dance hard. playing up and down the country, 2x comp winner has performed alongside acts such as Shy Fx, Krafty Kuts and The Freestylers while supporting top UK Hip Hop acts such as Chester P, Mystro n Foreign Beggars, With festival sets including Nass, Boardmasters n R.T.T.S. Flash also hosts a weekly radio show with sika studios on UKFM most sunday evenings bringin you the best in UNDERGROUND SOUND.
https://soundcloud.com/flash-harry-sika-fam


****LIVE****


FAT SANDWICH

"Funky GypHopSka salad & Roots with a dash of Jungle sauce, packed nicely into a big warm sub... 

Fat Sandwich are a Bristol(UK) based band playing a fine selection of musical ingredients, flavors and fillings. The unique 11 piece outfit combine elements of Reggae, Gypsy, Swing, Ska, Funk & Blues with a dash of Hip-Hop and a Junglist twist. Always an energetic, raucous knees up, fuelled by music that people just can't resist dancing too!
https://soundcloud.com/fatsandwich
https://www.facebook.com/fatsandwichmusic

THE SNEAK EAZIES

'Skank tastic bouncy fun time Ska'
Welcome to the sneakin' world of the Sneak Eazies. A Bristol based bunch of lovelies playing rocking skanking beats. Lots of bouncy tunes with heavy bass lines and blasting horns.
 7 friends playing ska with various bits of this and that thrown in for good measure. 
https://soundcloud.com/sneakeazies
https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Sneak-Eazies/163656753725375

PLAYHEAD

Playhead are a new and exciting 4 piece electronic band from Bristol, UK playing live dance music, merging club with live music cultures.
Combining the creative forces of two eminent producers - Jon Savage (real world) & Bruce Turner (DSR), and have worked and produced with some of the industry's finest: 
(Roni Size, Pendulum, TC, Jakes, Distorted Minds, Sub Focus, Fabio & Grooverider, Banco De Gaia, Squarepusher); the group have refined a wealth of conceptual and technical delivery with an ambitious, fiery and original live show. 
So far this year Album release, remixes for Squarepusher and Banco De Gaia and live video, studio recording.
https://soundcloud.com/playhead-2/diabolus-in-musica-bbc/s-OlXer
https://www.facebook.com/playheadhq


AMBASSADOR with FEDZILLA 

Heavyweight DubSelector from London. With a case full of nothing other than fatties and back up from the Beautiful Fedzilla. Ambassador is set to kick the party off in a true roots style & fashion.


HOSTS- FEDZILLA & KEV THE POET

WELCOME EVERYONE

ॐ We all want to be accepted as we are and loved unconditional, but yet we forget to accept ourselves as we are and embrace our love for us unconditionally! 

In the mystical Land of Transylvania, the only way to access this Land of Beatitude is as You are, and You are Love, we are All Love! 

We might be discouraged, we might feel alone and weak sometimes, but even so, in any moment of hardship, we remain the same, the same Substance of Love, so all our sufferings today are the blessings of tomorrow.  

The more of us gathered in One place the more powerful the manifestation of Love in this temporal World. 

See you ALL in the Forest of our Spirit!

Hello! 
Vi, i 2.c på Himmelev Gymnasium, drager mod London d. 6/4-2014. I denne anledning vil vi invitere jer til at opleve det vi skal på vores studietur. 

Kunne du tænke dig at shoppe second-hand på  Oxford street? Snuppe en øl på den lokale pub med dertilhørende peanuts? Tage til et ægte engelsk teaparty hvor du kan nyde et stykke kage? Eller er du mere til en tur i biografen til en alternativ musical, hvor du kan sidde og gnaske popcorn i mørket? 
Alt dette kan vi tilbyde dig på kun én dag i Londons undergrund. 

I vores London vil du i løbet af dagen have mulighed for at deltage i konkurrencer, som bordfodbold, dart og evt. Fifa. Du kan også købe lodder til vores lotteri, hvor lækre præmier udloddes til de heldige vindere. 
Lodderne koster: 
➢	1 for 5 kr. 
➢	3 for 10 kr. 
➢	7 for 20 kr. 

Og PRÆMIERNE som er på spil er: 

2 gaver poser fra frisørsalonen STENDER til en værdi af 250 kr. 

2 gaver fra Rud og vester

9 gaver fra Telenor 

3 gaver fra Matas 

2 gaveposer fra frisørsalonen Hair by Nature 

1 gave fra Smartyphone

2 gaver fra Apoteket 

2 gaver fra Wagner 

3 gaver fra First Lady 

1 gave fra helsebutikken Helsam 

1 gave The Body Shop 

1 kurv med brød og delikatesser fra Caseus ost og delikatesser 

10 gavekort til Optik Nicolai's til en værdi op til 1000 kr. 

Alle er velkomne, så tag venner og familie under armen og følg lyset ned til kælderen og du vil befinde dig i Londons centrum! 

Vi glæder os til at se jer og give jer muligheden for at opleve London! Vi håber i glæder jer ligeså meget som vi gør. 

Mange hilsner 2.c

1413230788910965.description:
20 PROFESSIONAL DANCERS GUESTS DIRECT FROM BRAZIL
+ 10 FROM AROUND THE WORLD

 LAMBAZOUK SAMBA LONDON DANCE CONGRESS 
July 2014

The Congress:

We are very pleased to be inviting all of you to participate at Brazilian Dance Congress in London. 
London is one of the most cosmopolitan cities in the world and it is also the only one to offer 4 lambadazouk nights per week in addition to other rhythms and dances such as Samba, Tango or Salsa. With all this diversity we decided to host this Congress in order to continue uniting people passionate about dance from all over the world, thereby further increasing the popularity of Lambada. 
We hope that you will join us at this event which will offer more than 3 days of workshops and shows constituting the 'official part', as well as 3 further dance party nights outside the congress dates, making the entire event a 4 day celebration. 
We are currently have place for the event next to Central London to facilitate the transfers between the hotels, restaurants and the event. London itself has a vast number of tourist attractions to visit during the day. In addition to that, the city is famous for its exciting nightlife offer ranging from musicals in the West End (the English Broadway) to charming cafes, nightclubs and many other exciting events catering for all preferences and tastes.

1415338338718867.description:
Direct from Buenos Aires, Melingo’s deep grouchy voice and his vividly sparse music well up from the world of tango in its early days. Sad, funny, intense, bizarre, fascinating, welcome to Melingo’s wry bohemian universe – a fabulous, boozy, theatrical milieu where Tolstoy, Kafka, Piaf, Brecht, Waits and Cohen might find solace and unsettled lodging.

Tonight Melingo launches  his new album Linyera, offbeat love songs, sparkling with glints of the blues and tangos of old, vagrants’ tales sprinkled with snatches of bossa nova and candombe, atmospheric melodies summoning up musical spirits, now of Duke, now of Zappa, all plunging us into Melingo’s surreal universe.  In the company of his band of itinerant musician-poets, he is a free-spirited, definition-defying artist at the very zenith of his powers.  Part rocker, part flamboyant crooner, with a touch of the comedian, as well as a multi-instrumentalist and composer, he bewitches us with intoxicating dreams.

“The man who makes Tango seriously cool!” The Independent

“A mesmerising stage presence.” The Times

“Imagine a proud hybrid of Paolo Conte and Ian Dury, with the facial mannerisms of a silent-film heavy.” The Guardian

Daniel Melingo: vocals, clarinet
Muhammad Habbibi el Rodra Guerra: electric guitar, saw
Pedro  Onetto:  piano,
“Marques” Gustavo  Paglia: bandoneón
Patricio  Cotella: double bass

Tickets £15 plus booking fee

★ ENZO SIRAGUSA

★ ALEXKID

★ SEB ZITO

★ RICH NxT

★ ITTETSU

★ DAN LIVELY

★ ANTONY DIFRANCESCO 

Since the very first FUSE party over half a decade ago, our roster of residents have been playing their own distinct sound – also known as ‘Fusic’. The FUSE London label launched a couple of years later as a platform for our residents and friends to release their tracks, which had been tried and tested on the FUSE faithful. 

On Sunday 23rd March, we’d like to invite you all to come and party with us at Village Underground from 3pm until midnight because we’re throwing one hell of a party to celebrate three massive years of FUSE London. 

With sets from seven great Djs, the label’s third birthday will definitely be one to remember. Playing some of the most-loved material from the past, present and future, our DJs will take you through an aural journey of the very best in Fusic. From Enzo Siragusa’s debut Sagamore EP to Enzo and Alexkid’s Kilimijaro project, Seb Zito's Seven Dials EP, Rich NxT's forthcoming Wasteline EP and the hugely popular Fuse Volume series.This is going to be one serious party.
 
Now encompassing sub-label INFUSE, the productions just keep on coming and with huge support from both established and up and coming Djs alike, there are no signs of slowing down. 

The label releases have seen our sound spread far and wide, culminating in global gigs for our residents everywhere from South Africa to Switzerland. With our residents and friends constantly making music in the studio, this next year will see even more releases and even more parties around the world. But as we return to our London home, we want to celebrate with the people who have partied with us since the very beginning.

See you on the dance floor. 


Follow FUSE on Twitter: @FUSE_London

Please add the Fuse Fan Page:
http://www.facebook.com/pages/FUSELondon

Hello Wonderful People!

Sacred Sound Gatherings arrive to London! also different Sound and Ceremony Events during 2014, after a long successful tour in the UK and Colombia.

These Sacred Sound Gatherings will be right in the Heart of London, in Angel, lead by Anthar Kharana from Colombia.

anthar@tribalsoundhealing.com

The use of Sound is becoming more and more well known in different fields. Sound is been used as a powerful tool to connect us with our inner realities and empowering people to discover their own vision and path to walk, as well as to have a relaxing experience yet deep. 

This is been the way that our Elders have always taught us with much kindness. The practice of respect for all what we are and everything that surround us. 

You are very welcome to join us in this Sound Ceremonies held right in the Heart of London where we will spread the big wave of vibrational intensions reaching many others who will received it in one way or another.

The gatherings will be limited to 13 participants, who will embody the different aspects of the wheel of an ancient calendar from our brothers of Central America, we will be talking about this in more detail during the gatherings.

Pre-booking your place is essential, do not miss out!

Instruments from different ancestral traditions including, flutes, singing bowls, gongs, voice and different rattles and healing tools used in rituals of purification around America, will be played following the purpose of the day.
This practice enhances the experience or inner quest and it will be presided by an opening ceremony to welcome and honour the four corners of the Medicine Wheel. We will also talk about the Nahual or Animal guide of the day which helps to lead the purpose. 

With much gratitude and respect for all the relations, 

Anthar Kharana

Calling all car clubs, groups and individuals, don't miss this unique free to attend event! 
 
If you are a member of a car forum or blog, please repost or share the below press release with friends.
 
Forms for Car Clubs wishing to take part are obtained via the contact details below, along with Terms & Conditions. Please complete both documents and return to the cafe.
 
If you are an individual and want to show off your motor, just drive in and park up!

ACE CAFE LONDON PRESENTS THE 4th ANNUAL INCARNATION - BRIGHTON

Calling all Petrolheads!  On Saturday 26th April 2014, from 10am - 6pm, Brighton's famous seafront road, Madeira Drive will again host the UK's finest on four wheels.

Conceived in 2011 following the popularity of the cafe's regular monthly InCarNation Night, held at the Ace on the last Wednesday of every month, with racers, tuners, car clubs and motor fans from across the country enjoying their "wheels" and vying for space, InCarNation Brighton 2014 is a free to attend drive-in and display of vehicles.

Focusing on the individuals who drive and their passions, and open to all motor fans and enthusiasts, from classic cars, hot rods, street-tuned racers, through to hot exotic supercars, prizes and awards will be up for grabs on the day, to include for "Best Club Car" and "Best Club Display", as well as individual spot prizes for "Best Motors". Along with SlammedUK on the spot trophies!

With stands, displays and entertainment on the Ace stage, if the roar of an Italian V10 engine is music to your ears, or a tyre shredding drifter gets your adrenalin pumping, make sure you don't miss this unique, free to attend, seaside event - InCarNation Brighton 2014.

Drive In, Park Up, Chill Out & Party!

Car Clubs are required to pre-book

1445096469053799.description:
For our first London Kumasi party of 2014 we've lined up something rather special for you. An exclusive 250 person intimate all-night rave in a true gem of a studio space which has never previously been used before for music events. Spread over 3 interlinking chambers and a main 2-tiered mezzanine studio space, we invite you to run and rave amok to the sounds of our choice Kumasi Music guests in this spine-tingling setting.

Headind the bill is Kumasi Music favourite, Rayko. Spanish producer extraordinaire Rayko has been a leading light in the nu-disco edits scene for the past 5 years. Deeply rooted in '70s and '80s disco, funk, boogie and rock, Rayko's influences are masterfully interpreted and transformed into modern day dancefloor bombs. His mind-blowing edit of Candi Staton's 'Broadway' was Juno's #1 disco record of 2011, and his exquisite remix of Barbara Keith's 'All Along The Watchtower' has racked up a whopping 136,000 Soundcloud plays - a platform which he has amassed over 22,000 followers. Rayko's DJ sets are stuff of legend, as such we're delighted to secure his services for our first all-night session of 2014.

Matt Fear continues his Kumasi Music residency and will purvey his bass-heavy interpretation of the slower nu-disco/house sound that has found such popularity across world dancefloors of recent times. Never one to dissapoint, his latest remix for Kumasi (out February) takes us on a typically emotionally charged bass led journey to the basement, warehouse, and back again with a sublime cut of jacking tech-house artistry. Playfully tossing us one way then the next, Fear's rework of Matteo Floris's 'Dance!' makes you do exactly what it says on the tin, and is all set to destroy dancefloors across the globe.

Italy-born Barcelona based Kumasi new signing Matteo Floris has provided us with our first EP of 2014. Both 'Dance!' and 'Let Me Tell Ya' are beautifully crafted tracks in their own right, and we can't wait to hear them loud and proud on March 22nd. London duo Tainted Souls round off the bill, armed to the teeth with the kind of big-hitting releases which have seen them be signed to such labels as Amine Edge & DANCE's 'CUFF', Kolombo's 'LouLou' and Rob Made's 'Sleazy Deep' imprints.

Expect the usual high level Kumasi production and visuals throughout the space. Earlybird tickets are on sale now at the bargain January Sale price of only £5! 

See you in the S-S-Studios!

Kumasi x

The London Easter Carnival @ Shaka- Zulu - 4am Finish  

Celebrate this Easter weekend in style!

Love London PR have pulled out all the stops to bring you an unforgettable night this coming Easter Sunday 20th April 2014.  Join us for "The London Easter Carnival" at London's breathtaking Shaka- Zulu, Camden!  A night with 900 party goers across 2 level's of the finest in House, RnB & Club Classics

This year we bring you a night in Rio De Janeiro. Recreating the atmosphere, style, entertainment of that of an authentic original Brazilian street party, we offer you a never seen before experience this Easter Sunday!

Love London PR presents "The London Easter Carnival". With Live Bongo & Steel Pan acoustics to accompany our resident DJ's and entertainers of the night Love London PR has spared no expense and takes great care in delivering you the ultimate Easter satisfactory experience. 

Expect Brazlian & Flamingo Street dancers, Carnival themed Hostesses & Waiters, Carnival Masquerade, and much more all in the hustle and bustle of the Camden's famous Camden Market.  

All guests before midnight will be issued a complimentary Carnival Mask (Masqurade style) or optional face-painter for the theme. Get you ticket NOW and be a part of "The London Carnival" this East Sunday! An EPIC experience not to be missed!

• Shaka- Zulu - The Venue

Shaka Zulu is absolutely stunning and without doubt the most beautiful venue in London right now. With 60ft giant statues, meat flavored cocktails and a giant escalator taking you between floors it provides a totally unique clubbing experience. Prepare to be amazed as you move through the venue and marvel at the intricate detail captured on each carved wall and ceiling panel.

The design has earned Shaka Zulu numerous accolades including the prestigious prize of ‘best interior design’ at the London Club and Bar Awards 2012.  Located in Stables Market in Camden and based over two floors, Shaka Zulu is the perfect place to let loose this Easter. Resident DJ's play the best of House, Funkyhouse Commercial Rnb and Club Classic This will prove to be the perfect solution for those of you seeking a slightly more unique, innovative experience outside the westend!

1449924518571037.description:
Wednesday March 19th, 2014
Konkrete Jungle Minneapolis Presents: 



MAMPI SWIFT - Charge Recordings - London, UK

www.facebook.com/mampiswiftrecordings

The very definition of a legend, Mampi Swift has been involved in the drum & bass scene since the early 90’s. It was in 1990 that Swift started DJing and found himself behind the counter of Lucky Spin records. With access to the studio next door and an in-house engineer, Swift jumped at the valuable opportunity to start learning how to produce. Releases soon started filtering out with labels like Suburban Base, True Playaz, Trouble On Vinyl & Frontline all taking tracks.

1997 saw the launch of Charge Recordings, and a slur of releases that saw him rise meteorically to the top of the DnB tree. With the release of ‘The One’, Swift became a household name and he showed no signs of slowing up, following that up with the likes of ‘Hi Tek’, ‘Touch Of J’, ‘Jaws’ and ‘Trippin’. The label went from strength to strength and has since seen releases from Fresh, Friction, Blame, Sigma, Gridlok and more.

In the DJ booth, Mampi is a force to be reckoned with and it’s arguably where he feels most at home. A pioneer of the double drop style of DJing alongside Andy C, his unmistakeable presence behind the decks has formed the back bone of many a line up from the UK to the States and everywhere in between. A true originator he has influenced and shaped the scene like few others.

After a couple of years out, Mampi Swift & Charge Recordings are back in the biggest way. The long awaited ‘History LP’ has been heavily supported by the likes of Andy C, MistaJam, Friction, Hype, Crissy Criss & Bailey. Tracks such as 'Gangster', 'Soldiers' & 'The Silence' have been destroying dance floors worldwide! Fast forward to Autumn 2013 and surely a career highlight for Swift as his monstrous remix of Dizzee Rascal's 'I Dont Need A Reason' took his profile to another level. The track was featured heavily on both mainstream & underground radio, and was critically acclaimed to be "The most most disgusting slice of D&B in the last 5 years!" - Zane Lowe.

Expect big things in 2014 - There is so much more to come!


With Konkrete Jungle Residents:

Dieses Mal überqueren wir den Ärmelkanal, Ziel: London. In dieser pulsierenden Metropole, in der sich täglich unterschiedlichste Kulturen und historische Hintergründe begegnen, ist die karibische Community eine der aktivsten und präsentesten. Denken wir nur an den Notting Hill Carnival!

Uscirà il  20 febbraio “Made in London”, il nuovo album di Noemi contenente i due brani presentati al 64° Festival di Sanremo “Bagnati dal sole” e “Un uomo è un albero”.
Noemi torna con una nuova maturità artistica e personale sviluppata grazie ad esperienze professionali e non che le hanno aperto orizzonti diversi. 
Questo album, come annunciato dal titolo, nasce e si è sviluppa a Londra e vede un grandissimo impegno personale dell’artista sia dal punto di vista autorale che produttivo, infatti la produzione artistica è curata della stessa Noemi. “Made in London” vanta inoltre grandissime collaborazioni con autori come Paul Statham,  Poul O’ duffy e Shelly Poole e con produttori inglesi tra cui Steve Brown – appena nominato per i Britt Award come miglior album di quest’anno di Laura Mvula – e gli Electric .

Queste le date in calendario del “MADE IN LONDON TOUR” di Noemi, una produzione Massimo Levantini per Live Nation:

1462901100595104.description:
Nikita's London Calling (Chapter 3) Feat. D'Julz, Bill Patrick, Ben Annand, Patrick Gil, Max Gardner, Brian Knarfield, Bob Five, Bells & Whistles, + a Special Guest that just happens to be in town... ;)

Sunday, March 23rd, 2014
12:PM - 12:AM

Line-up /
D'JULZ (Bass Culture-Paris)
BILL PATRICK (ROBOTS, Supplement Facts | Berlin/NYC)
BEN ANNAND (Tropical-LA) 
PATRICK GIL (Direct to Earth/DeepLabs, Gynoid Audio)
MAX GARDNER (Direct to Earth)
BRIAN KNARFIELD (Direct to Earth)
BOB FIVE (Direct to Earth)
BELLS & WHISTLES (Four Sweaters / AYLI -SF) 
+ A Special Guest That Just Happens To Be In Town

///

D'JULZ (Bass Culture Records | Paris)
www.djulz.com/
www.lola-ed.com/artists/djulz
www.facebook.com/djulz
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/djulz

Whether it’s through his productions, radio shows, compilations, parties or club sets, D'Julz has been at the forefront of electronic music since his career first began back in 1992. A firm DJ and fan favourite alike, his ability to transcend genres and trends has seen him hold one of the most consistent levels of success of any modern-­‐day DJ/Producer. A run of form that is at its strongest, today.
D'Julz's early career saw him make an instant impact in his home city of Paris, spinning at many of the city's early raves and legendary clubs. A hugely successful move to New York in 1993 quickly furthered his reputation, and upon his return to Europe he found himself to be in high demand, playing key clubs in Belgium, Holland, the UK and Ibiza.

1997 saw the birth of his now legendary 'Bass Culture' night at Rex Club, Paris. The monthly party has become the longest running event in the club’s history, and in 2009 gave its name to D'Julz's highly successful record label. His impact on the club was further celebrated in 2010 when he was asked to mix the debut Rexperience compilation of the series, coinciding with the 15th year of the Bass Culture parties.

Producing since the mid 90's, his music has featured on some of the world’s finest labels –20:20 Vision, Dessous, Pokerflat, Safari, Get Physical, Mobilee, Rekids, Systematic, 100% Pure – tracks and remixes that have become essential weapons in the record boxes of the world's elite. 2008's ‘Just so You Know’ on Ovum and 'Fleurette' on Circus Company became instant classics, as did his debut EP on Bass Culture ‘Fofoca’. His remixes of Slam's 'Positive Education' on Soma, Barem’s ‘Is’ on M_nus and Franck Roger’s ‘After All’ on Real Tone, have all ruled the DJ and download charts alike.

D'Julz continues to travel the world playing the likes of fabric London, Panorama Bar Berlin, Amnesia Ibiza, not to mention regular appearances at the infamous Circoloco, DC10 . The future has never been more exciting for the Frenchman as Bass Culture label grows from strength to strength, and as a producer he continues to raise the bar with recent releases like ‘Special Day’ on Circus Company. Recently becoming the newest addition to Lola ED agency, 2013 see D’Julz join the like-­‐minded Parisian crew of some of the most in-­‐demand underground house and techno artists.

///

BILL PATRICK (Robots, Supplement Facts | Berlin/NYC)
www.soundcloud.com/billpatrick
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/billpatrick
www.facebook.com/billpatrick.ny

In America, specifically NYC, Bill Patrick is a man of many accolades... Since his days as a DJ in legendary clubs such as The Limelight, Vinyl & Arc, he has charmed our hearts and moved our bodies. Not to mention being co-founder of the famed Robots parties and amusing us weekly as Robot Radio's alluring and witty host. Within the world of electronic music everyone has a tale about our friend Bill Patrick. Some funny, some sad, some tragic, most shady, but at the end of each story or any encounter with this demi god you're left wanting more.

In 2008, this mythical creature, who by chance was reborn a man, relocated to Berlin. Why? Few know. Some say it was in search of gold, some suggest it was out of self loathing, those in his inner circle say it was to be closer to them. He says it was to challenge the European state of mind and how sexually active they, as a people, can become. In any event all legend and lore were left behind. So where has that left this man, this nu-romantic? I'll tell you, striving to be more. It doesn't matter that the only place he now plays are mega festivals like Sunwaves in Romania, or super clubs like DC10, Fabric, and Rex in Paris. Currently holding the A&R title for Guy Gerber's Supplement Facts label and hosting his wildly popular radio show, Private Stock on Pulse Radio, Bill still finds time to update his Facebook fan page and send out extremely well written tweets. But he wants to step out of his box and come to you, to educate the minds of the world with his deep, psychedelic take on contemporary dance music. With the help of his unwavering comrades; Seth Troxler, Guy Gerber, Ryan Crosson and Shaun Reeves, he is destined to thrive!

- Words by Seth Troxler

///

BEN ANNAND (Moontribe, Tropical House, LA)
www.soundcloud.com/ben-annand
www.facebook.com/benannandmusic
www.residentadvisor.net/profile/benannand

Ben Annand has been djing and producing events based from his home in Los Angeles since 1996.  In his zone on vinyl, CDJs, or both, he pairs impeccably smooth mixing skills with a dynamic mixing style that keeps the music moving.  His music is dreamy, atmospheric and deep, crossing the genres of house, tech-house and techno and defying categorization strictly in one.  

Buying his first records at 23rd Precinct in Edinburgh Scotland in the summer of 96, Ben returned to the States determined to learn how to mix records and was already thinking about the future, declaring his next trip to Europe would be when he was paid to dj there.  He was a quick study and started playing out at parties in late 1997, had his first international gig in Quito, Ecuador in January 1999 and followed that with a summer 1999 Moontribe Tour in Canada.  In 2000 he made 5 trips to Mexico City’s Club Rimel, 1 to Guadalajara, and closed out the Jazz stage of the Aca World Sound Festival in Acapulco.   Within 5 years of first trying to match 2 beats together, Ben accomplished his Europe goal with pizazz in May 2001 with a 6-gig, 4-country tour that ranged from a small club in a 13th century building in Portugal, to the 20,000 person Festimad in Madrid, a 10-year running underground warehouse party in the UK, and finally ending at the now world-famous Propaganda Club in Moscow.

From 2001-2010 Ben became rather famous in Russia as one of the top-booked dis at Propaganda with 13 visits in those years, appearing on a one-hour show Russian National Television which aired to over 2 million people, and djing outside of Moscow in 9 other Russian cities spread across its 9 time zones - St.Petersburg, Murmansk, Ekaterinburg, Chelyabinsk, Magnitigorsk, Sakhalin, Krasnoyarsk, Saratov and Orenburg (where he was the first American dj ever).

In that time he also made several trips to Spain, playing in Madrid, La Coruna, Santiago de Campostela, Vigo, and Lloret de Mar.  In 2007 he notched one of the world’s top honors for a tech-house dj, playing for in London for Nathan Coles at Wiggle at Fabric.  His success was not confined to Europe; in both 2007 and 2008 he played the Labyrinth Festival in Japan, which many top djs consider the best house/techno festival in the world.  

The past three years have seen a shift in focus for Ben from international touring to becoming rooted closer to home, establishing himself on the West Coast USA Festival circuit with peak-time appearances at Photosynthesis (WA), Esthetic Evolution (ID), and Desert Hearts (CA) among many others, while continuing his 16-year running residency with Moontribe, one of Southern California’s original outdoor events and one which has influenced most other outdoor parties on the West Coast.  He also continues organizing his own nonprofit event, Tropical, which stands out amongst Socal parties for having given its participants extras like free smoothies and massage and in the early days, mixtapes, while over the years while also making a positive impact on the outside community with over $13,000 in charitable donations to date.

The number and caliber of gigs Ben played all over the world in the first 15 years of his career is a testament to his being one of the more skilled and unique djs out there.  Having not produced any tracks over this span, he has always been hired for his skill and has truly succeeded on an underground level, fully focused on his mixing and providing memorable nights of music to partygoers.  Yet as his vision matured Ben became more and more interested on the idea of making his own music and finally released his first track on Laus Recordings in June 2012.  Wanting to improve on the result, Ben began taking voice and piano lessons shortly thereafter to better understand music theory and take some of the music making off the computer.  In 2014 he continues with voice and piano lessons and has begun integrating his knowledge (and voice) into projects using Maschine, Ableton Live, and Logic Pro.  Look for his next release in the near future.

/// 

NIKITA (listed, London Calling | SF)
www.facebook.com/TheOfficialDJNikita
www.soundcloud.com/djnikita
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/nikita

On the same day Dolly Parton, Janis Joplin, Edgar Allen Poe, his mother and grandmother were born, so too did San Francisco DJ NIKITA begin his enchanted existence. As a young boy in Denver, Colorado, NIKITA's childhood was similar to that of other creative youth, days filled with singing, playing the piano, and dancing to his mother's R&B albums. From an early age, NIKITA always knew he wanted to be an entertainer. Then, in 1993, a chance encounter with house music at an underground warehouse party would prove to be a pivotal moment in his life, ultimately guiding NIKITA towards the charmed life he lives today.

It wasn't until the turn of the millennium though that NIKITA would leave his home in Colorado to search the clubs and warehouses of San Francisco for his destiny. At the very least, he would get a degree in music business from San Francisco State University. But with a resounding perseverance and an inimitable personality, NIKITA quickly earned his place among the upper echelon of DJs in San Francisco's world-renowned club scene. In 2005, NIKITA was chosen to host his own radio show, The Massive Mix, on Northern California's only electronic dance music radio station, Energy 92.7 FM. Indeed, it was NIKITA's penchant for blending raw grooves with sophisticated sounds that garnered him a residency at San Francisco's legendary nightclub, The EndUp.

NIKITA is a DJ's DJ, a rare soul who truly understands his role in the DJ booth. Performing anywhere from two to twelve hour sets, NIKITA weaves music into fantastic journeys of rhythm and sound. NIKITA's ability to contrast the harder elements of techno with the soulful sensuality of deep house has garnered him accolades from some of the world's best DJs and allowed him the rare opportunity to tag team alongside the likes of Lee Burridge, Cassy and Derek Plaslaiko. Indeed, NIKITA has played with a Who's Who of international talent, including Danny Howells, Loco Dice, Steve Lawler, Craig Richards, Steve Bug, Joel Mull, Adam Beyer, Damian Lazurus, M.A.N.D.Y. and many, many more. With additional inspiration coming from friends such as Ms. Honey Dijon, Tedd Patterson and Danny Tenaglia, it comes as no wonder why NIKITA's story is one of a dream come true.

written by Jack O'Shaughnessy

///

PATRICK GIL (DeepLabs, Direct to Earth, Gynoid Audio)
Soundcloud.com/patrickgil
Facebook.com/Patrickgilmusic
Residentadvisor.net/DJ/patrickgil
http://www.directtoearth.com

Patrick has lived in California all his life, and it shapes his interpretation of electronic music. Raised in the 90's and 00's on psychedelic rock, jazz, electronica, indie, singer songwriter - and later on - techno and house music, he finds strains of inspiration through the music he was exposed to and has been creating since age 15. He works as a live sound and video production engineer, as well as an event producer in San Francisco; and has successfully found a way to merge his career and passion into a happy medium, that translates into his body of work. 

His production technique is shaped by analog synthesizers, guitar pedals, software tricks, far-out samples, and dub techniques. His productions have appeared at the likes of Berghain/Panorama Bar, Space Club Ibiza, Fabric London, Movement Festival Detroit, Slam Radio, and other various radio shows and podcasts all over the world. He believes in simple and spacious sounds that translate into an open canvas for every DJ to interpret his own story through. 

As a DJ himself, he prefers long, smooth and spacious mixing and storytelling through the slow build. He seeks the same qualities in the music he plays as the produces. Lush but dissonant, slow grooving but jacking; he tries always to find the 'in-between' sounds that stretch out the minds of listeners and dancers. He prefers to play without a computer, and keeps the mixes smooth and tight, with bits of surprises along the way.  2014 is looking positive with many gigs,  the launch of his own vinyl imprint called 'Pressed Friends', as well as forthcoming pieces of wax on CMYK and Space.

///

BRIAN KNARFIELD (Direct to Earth)
www.beatport.com/artist/brian-knarfield/103921
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/brianknarfield/
www.facebook.com/Brianknarfield
www.soundcloud.com/brian-knarfield
http://www.directtoearth.com/

It was the  summer of 2000 when Brian ditched space camp to learned to spin. The intensity of school and the threatening thoughts of staying a Mobile DJ forever began to poke and jab as the years went on. Brian began producing and  playing Techno-inspired beats under the Knarfield ("gnar-field") moniker in 2008 . in 2011 Brian Co-founded the Direct to Earth Party crew and continues to express himself musically at DTE events, while also captivating strangers at other affairs. 

///

MAX GARDER (Direct to Earth)
www.facebook.com/maxgardner.dte
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/maxgardner
www.soundcloud.com/max-gardner
www.dj.beatport.com/maxgardner

Max's style is all over the spectrum of electronic music: ranging from playful minimal and house, to deep techno and experimental productions.  As a student in Arizona, he was raising the bar for underground music. The originality of his DJ sets had him quickly recognized throughout the state and he became a regular performer at large-scale events featuring big name guests. He was playing music that was completely new to his region, regardless of when it was actually released. With a heady, yet distinguished taste, Max set himself apart from his peers. Eventually, his love for deeper and more experimental sounds led him back to his natural habitat of the San Francisco bay area.

After settling down Max refocused his direction towards jam sessions in the studio. He strived to find his own sound by working hard on mastering his gear and developing his own production technique. As a result of being surrounded by a wide range of electronic sounds, Max decided to team up with music aficionado, Brian Knarfield and founded the event series Direct To Earth (DTE), originally based out of Oakland, CA. DTE continues to provide a home for techno and the underground dance music community throughout the bay area.

Since the move, Max has performed at shows featuring artists such as Dustin Zahn, Luke Hess, Troy Pierce, Raiz, Max Cooper, Heiko Laux, Pig & Dan, Tim Xavier, Timo Maas, Marco Bailey, [a]pendics.shuffle, Jay Tripwire, Evil Eddie Richards, Barem, Noah Pred, Nico Stojan, Echospace, Sante, Hollen, Harvey Mckay and Octave among many others. He's also released his first EP with Seeder and saw it reach #11 on the Beatport minimal charts. Max feels out the dancefloor. He can sense what they want. Sometimes he plays raw, gritty, heavy and experimental; other times it's more inviting, friendly, and groovy. While pushing the limits and trying new things, he commonly sneaks original productions into his DJ sets.  

Max always has fun behind the decks, and it truly shows. With an exquisite taste in sound, seemless mixing and an intelligent track selection, he's a master at setting the vibe just how he wants it.  He is a frequent performer at the bay area’s most celebrated nightclubs and undergrounds, and has also made appearances in Las Vegas, Colorado, Black Rock City, and throughout Arizona.

///

BOB FIVE (Direct to Earth, Star Kommand)
www.facebook.com/i.m.bob.five
www.soundcloud.com/bobfive
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/bobfive
http://www.directtoearth.com

bob five roots run deeps in san francisco underground house/techno world. A constant presence in the scene since the mid 90s, bob's performed both near and far, from Black Rock City to the depths of the Santa Cruz forests. His sound can range from heady dreamy deep house to the darker edges of techno. from rare grooves to the latest heat his style of mixing takes you on a voyage blending genres into one seamless soundscape. listen closely to the story he tells and maybe you can also find the deeper meaning he hides within.

Riot Jazz is an infamous, live music club night, known as the most raucous nights in Manchester. Now it's coming to London, and the big smoke isn't going to know whats hit it...
 
• • RIOT JAZZ comes to LONDON! • •

TICKETS
£8 BADDABINGO EARLY BIRD FLAMINGO 
£12 SOLD OUT
£15
Skiddle: http://bit.ly/1fQ6hmw
 
Room 1
• RIOT JAZZ BRASS BAND
• HONEYFEET
• TOO MUCH LOVE
 
Room 2
• WALK
• TANTZ
• DAKOTA JIM BAND - WHISKEY MOON FACE
 
DJs
• ALEXANDER NUT
• RICH REASON
• COOPS
 
As the man said: “Start a movement – eat a prune!”
 
And so, with bellies full of plumb cultivars and lips dripping with trumpet juice, the Riot Jazz-mobile yanks and banks and rolls south from Manchester…
 
…on FRIDAY 28th March, the sun shall rise from the North West!


At Riot Jazz, anything is possible: a place of dreams and liquid wondermint. A one-night-only-festival where the air is thick with pumping jazz and sweat beads cling to the walls like a colony of bats having nocturnal emissions.
 
Chase the feeling! Join the undulating mass of flesh and dance into the night and get your kicks, before the morning comes and you retrace your steps, hopping on your good feet, back along on the road paved with bold intentions…
 
…the road to Riot Jazz.
 
 
• ¡ RIOT JAZZ BRASS BAND ! • 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6xM12g8MD-g
 
These guys put their jazz pants on one leg at a time, just like the next man. The only difference is, when these guys get them jazz pants on, they make sweet and sweaty, export-strength, brass-packed euphoria!
 
Body-surfing national TV and radio waves and bouncing across country and continent - with appearances at Glastonbury, Fusion, Bestival, V Fest, Soundwave Croatia and many more - the original peace-loving aggro-jazz guerrilla have started a movement of their own!
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
"Riot Jazz's brass-heavy jazz combo pack a hefty punch" / The Guardian
 
“…my personal highlight, Riot Jazz, whose unique blend of funk, jazz and hip-hop absolutely smashed it… …if you’ve yet to witness a crowd whipped into a frenzy by a sousaphone solo then I suggest you rectify that at the earliest opportunity and catch one of their upcoming shows.” / Festivalcorner.co.uk
 
∆ Think!
A New Orleans first line lost in the Balkan mountains, with only Chunky to lead them home!
 
Stare into the eyes of the most handsome jazzmen north of Watford Junction. Then get ready for more!
 

• ¡ HONEYFEET ! •
http://www.honeyfeet.org/
A wonderband of royalty from Manchester’s live music scene - If Tom Waits was a happier woman he wouldn’t sound half as good as this!
 
Riognach Connolly, the songbird of a generation, and her merry gentlemen are
musical wizards with a cauldron full of hand-clappin’, bum-wrigglin’ concotions!  
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
 “seldom has conspicuous talent been more accessable” / CityLife
 
∆ Think!
Three hours into a lock-in at an irish blues bar in antebellum East Berlin.
 

• ¡ WALK ! •
http://vimeo.com/walkmusic
 
This new Manchester two-piece has created “sequencer blues” – a high-proof blend of hard-oak blues of the same universe as Valerie June and The Black Keys, but set on a different planet by the drummer’s ambidextrous, multi-tasking, electro-flavouring sequencer-play. These guys have grabbed us by the proverbials like few others – it’s time for the groins of London to feel that tug!  
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
“Absolutely love it!” / BBC Radio 6 Mark Riley
 
“The kick with WALK is the evolution to sequencer blues; leaving electric blues in the past by warping their sonic creations with 21st Century electronic gadgetry.” / Now Then
 
∆ Think!
Giorgio Moroder and Nina Simone served an umbrella cocktail by Robert Johnson
 

• ¡ TANTZ ! •
www.facebook.com/tantzleeds
Steamy-fresh from the Brit Awards After Party, Tantz Take their name from the age-old Yiddish adage “Freilich! Tantz yer pants off!” And when these meshugeners’ mix of power-klezmer with dub, hiphop and Balkan beats hits ludicrous-speed, you best be wearing both belt and braces!
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
'Tantz are a remarkable collective of talented equals making the most of traditional material in a truly modern way… by the end of their set they’d earned a serious dance response from a happy and sweaty canteen crowd.' / Tony Benjamin, Venue Magazine
 
'4 tracks of klezmer crossover with eastern influences and a nod to the dance floor…this is fantastically played and written stuff!!!'/ Jumbo Records review of Tantz’s newest EP: ‘Etrog Pomander’
 
∆ Think!
Itzhak Perlman at the Star Wars cantina on the first night that droids are allowed in!
 

• ¡ THE DAKOTA JIM BAND - WHISKEY MOON FACE ! •
http://www.whiskeymoonface.co.uk/
 
Toe-rag and broken-bone old time jazz, brimming with hopeful revelry! 

Vaudeville blues and North Indian classical music crash together above a Francophone Mississippi delta in a phantasmagoria of Louisa Jones’ velveteen rasp, the clarion-call clarinet of Ewan Bleach and the tub-thumping, legs akimbo-banging legendary double bass and accordion-play of North Dakota’s finest and most travelled gentleman, Dakota Jim.  
 
If you’ve ever been found wandering in the early hours of the final night of a summer festival – this is what you were hoping to find!
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
“Louisa Jones is the girl with a suitcase full of songs. Well known & loved in the homemade, handmade realm of the Hackney backstreets; a sheer delight brimming with vitality” / Upstairs at The Ritzy
 
∆ Think!
Amélie Poulain reshot as an American folk-tale in Super 8 on an inter-continental train travelling back in time.
 

• ¡ TOO MUCH LOVE ! •
www.soundcloud.com/tmlmusic/sets/2013-1
www.facebook.com/TMLmusic
 
Brothers and sisters are as close as hands and feet but siblings Vicky and Simi Freund have a beating telepathic musical connection that is almost palpable as they steer their clam-tight horn and rhythm sections into the funky lands and get brothers sliding, sisters bouncing, hands jumping and feet clapping.
 
Live, pumping cosmic soul disco and afro-cuban rhythms, straight from the top shelf!
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
“Too Much Love giving us just the right amount of love!” / Kendal Calling
 
“If Barry White saved your life or got you back with your old ex-wife, Too Much Love will keep that emotion cooking!” / J Lifschutz
 
∆ Think!
Roy Ayers and Dusty Springfield playing beach-volleyball against a summer sunset
 
Stand up and be counted!

•  •  • Riot Jazz – Colourfill your soul! •  •  •

Raising funds for Doctors Without Borders/ Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF)

1479107098983905.description:
Tues 29 April: THE GARAGE http://www.ticketweb.co.uk/event/AJI29041?camefrom=CFC_UK_MAMA_GARAGE&brand=thegarage
Sat 3 May: THE SURYA http://www.seetickets.com/event/honest-plain-john/surya/778452
Sat 10 May: HOPE & ANCHOR
Fri 27 June: THE WATER RATS

HONEST JOHN PLAIN to play his first solo band gigs in London in 10 years.

Honest John Plain met Matt Dangerfield at Art College in Leeds and moved to London with him in 1971.  Dangerfield, joined London SS with Casino Steel, Mick Jones (The Clash), Tony James (Generation X) and Brian James (The Damned) with Plain joining them on drums for one session.  As London SS disintegrated in 1975 Plain, Dangerfield and Steel formed The Boys.  

The Boys quickly built up a reputation as a white-hot live band and in January 1977 became the first punk band to sign an album deal when they signed away their recording lives to NEMS.  After signing for NEMS Plain sold The Boys equipment for £500 and put it on a horse, which came second!  This and other dodgy deals quickly earned him the nickname ‘Honest’.

Widely tipped to make it big The Boys had an arsenal of killer songs penned by Steel/Dangerfield & Plain and were highly respected by both the music press and their peers.  They quickly became known as ‘The Beatles of Punk’ but unfortunately through a series of poor marketing, bad decisions and appalling luck they never converted their potential to chart success.  However they still managed to record four killer albums and release several sure-fire hit singles before finally calling it a day in the summer of 1981.  During 1978/79 Siobhan Fahay (later of Bananarama) and Hazel O’Connor ran The Boys fan club.  In 1979 Plain had a brief spell with The Lurkers and co-wrote their hit single “New Guitar In Town” with guitarist Pete Stride whom he subsequently recorded an album, aptly titled “New Guitars In Town.

After the demise of The Boys Plain joined the Dirty Strangers and recorded an album with Keith Richards and Ronnie Woods of the Rolling Stones.  In August 1984 he joined The Mannish Boys.  Managed by Denny Laine’s wife Jo Jo they quickly built up a live following and interest from several record companies before agreeing a deal with Motown.  Unfortunately the band were dropped as soon as Motown found out they were white!  

By this time German punk band Die Toten Hosen were beginning to make an impact across Europe and their lead singer Campino made it known that his favourite band of all time were The Boys.  He offered a support slot to the Tower Block Rockers on the proviso that they could persuade Plain to join the band.  Plain quickly came to realise that he and Tower Block Rockers guitarist Darrell Bath formed a formidable writing/performing partnership and they formed the Crybabys who were voted ‘Best New Band of 1991’ in Kerrang Magazine.

1n 1993 Plain recorded his first solo album “Honest John Plain & Friends”, which featured guest appearances from many of his friends including Dangerfield, Bath, Robbie Rushton, Campino and Vom Ritchie.  Plain’s second solo album “Honest John Plain & Amigos” was released on 12 May 2003 to great critical acclaim and consequently Plain formed a new band to promote it.  His old mate Robbie Rushton (Crybabys, Mannish Boys, The Gunslingers) was brought in on drums with Mat Sargent (Sham 69, Chelsea, Splodge) joining on bass.  They made their debut as headlining act at the Punk Is Dead Festival in Holland on 17 October 2003 followed by a European tour.  

Honest John Plain & The Amigos debut album “One More And We’re Staying was released on 10 April 2006 with a French tour to promote it.

At the beginning of 2007 Plain and his old friend Casino Steel agreed to form a new punk supergroup to play Ramones-influenced rock’n’roll with a hint of Dolly Parton.  The result was “The Last Rock’n’Roll Band” featuring Plain’s Amigos Mat Sargent & Robbie Rushton alongside Petter Baarli (Backstreet Girls).  Their self titled debut album was released on October 7 2007.  Plain released his first acoustic album “Honest John Plain Untuned” on Still Unbeatable Records in Germany in 2009.

In the summer of 2011 Plain went into the iconic Rockfield Recording Studios in Monmouth, Wales to record a solo album for release in the fall of 2012.  Amongst others Plain recruited Glen Matlock (Sex Pistols), Martin Chambers (The Pretenders), Michael Monroe (Hanoi Rocks), Sami Yaffa (Hanoi Rocks & New York Dolls), Casino Steel (the Boys & Holton/Steel), Darrell Bath (The Crybabys & Dogs D’Amour), Verden Allen (Mott The Hoople) and Die Toten Hosen.

During December 2011 Plain embarked on a month long European tour showcasing his solo acoustic show.  The following month he teamed up with Italian band The Landslide Ladies for an Italian tour with a live album “Honest Alive” released on 10  June 2012.

In July 2012 Plain recorded a video for his single “Never Listen To Rumours” with acclaimed director Tony Klinger (The Kids Are Alright, Deep Purple Rises Over Japan). Michael Monroe, Sami Yaffa, Casino Steel, Martin Chambers, Verden Allen & Darrell Bath all flew in from around the world to appear in the video.

He toured Europe again with The Landslide Ladies in 2013 as well as performing numerous solo acoustic shows.

The Boys have just finished recording their first album since 1981’s “Boys Only” and it is set to be released in 2014.  Plain continues to tour extensively with the band The Boys with dates in Uruguay, Argentina, Brazil, Spain, France, UK, Canada, Italy, Slovakia, Czech Republic, Norway, Sweden, Italy, Germany & Japan in the past couple of years to be followed by numerous live dates across the globe planned for 2014 and beyond.  

After almost 40 years in the music business Plain’s musical career is looking extremely healthy with many young musicians citing him as a major influence.  The release the new Boys album in 2014 along with gigs aplenty with The Boys as well as his own solo gigs is certain to enhance his growing reputation and increase his popularity even further.

156886837815709.description:
'Did you know that there are over 500,00 people of Turkish descent living in the United Kingdom? 

Did you know that of those, around 350,00 live in London?

Turkish day in London is a unique event inspired by the Turkish community living here in the United Kingdom. Our event offers a full day packed full of activities and features that deliver the best and most accessible way to enjoy a Turkish cultural experience outside of Turkey.  

From live performances by leading Turkish artists and musicians to  recreations of Turkeys greatest landmarks, visitors can enjoy a complimenting mixture of modernity and tradition in a quintessentially British location with a distinctly Turkish atmosphere.'

This year, UK & Turkey Events set out to organise “Turkish Day In London” in Trafalgar Square, exposing Turkish culture to the masses with an event that was to be the first of its kind in the United Kingdom and on a massive scale.

Our vision was to exhibit the diverse colours and vibrancy of the Turkish community in London whilst engaging with Londoners. Indeed, Turkish Day In London had the full support of the Turkish community of London along with many Anglo-Turkish institutions, the Turkish Embassy, Consulate and Chamber Of Commerce among them.

We have received feedback from our fans on Facebook and our community and discovered that there was a significant preference for Turkish Day In London to be held in either Spring or Summer rather than in November 2013. We appreciate that the British winter doesn't do a Turkish celebration justice!

Therefore we have decided to postpone the event to take place on the 17th May 2014, taking advantage of the beautiful British summer weather.

We appreciate that the postponement will be met by disappointment by some, but we are committed to holding a fantastic family-friendly Turkish Day In London and will continue as always to welcome the support of our community here in London. 

Watch this space!
156886837815709.name: Turkish Day in London 2014
