London Album launch
Tickets only £7 - http://bit.ly/JK6hf6 or http://bit.ly/1lvI2z4

with support from:
Nightworkers 
"and Black box Red

After 97 shows in 2013 all over Europe and USA, Dutch psychedelic rockers BIRTH OF JOY have already proven to be a true LIVE rock sensation! Besides creating catchy psychedelic 60/70’s-hooks spiced up with stoner, blues and rock&roll influences, this threesome is also master in invoking a primal emotion that lays hidden in many of us. The kind of emotion that craves to burst out when you experience something true, something real. Well, these guys are it, they ARE the real deal: sex, drugs and rock&roll! Blood, sweat and… ah, mostly alcohol!
 
New Album: Early November the band finished recordings for their second official album. JORIS WOLFF is behind the knobs (e.g. De Staat, Within Temptation and Mister and Mississippi) and mastering is done by BRIAN LUCEY (e.g. The Black Keys, Artic Monkeys, David Lynch and Dr. John).
 
Release Dates: For the new album BOJ signed a worldwide deal with LONG BRANCH RECORDS (e.g. Everlast, Prong and Chimaira), a label from SPV GmbH. For France and Japan the band signed with MODULOR/GRAND PALAIS, and SUBURBAN RECORDS takes care of the Benelux. The new album will be released in Benelux on February 1st and in all other countries in March.
 
European Tour: Birth Of Joy starts 2014 with 2 shows at EUROSONIC NOORDERSLAG and goes on to do an extensive European clubtour from February to May. In February the band plays Dutch and Belgian venues, in March USA, UK and Switserland will be visited, in April France and Germany and in May Denmark, Norway, Sweden and Finland. Quite a schedule, but yeah, touring is what these guys do best! From half May on the band will be trashing the summerfestivals of course! All dates will be announced asap!
 
www.birthofjoy.com
www.longbranchrecords.com
www.moduledistribution.com
www.suburban.nl

BlackBoxRed
"This is one boy/girl duo who aren't dealing in cute and cuddly lo-fi. Fast, furious, and possessing more attitude in their smudged eyeliner than should be legal."

We are delighted and excited to announce the MODSTOCK program here http://www.newuntouchables.com/home/

Tickets are on sale now here www.229thevenue.co.uk 

Write this date in your diary and grab yourselves a piece of the action folks, this is the BIG one. New Untouchables present ‘MODSTOCK- 50 years of Mod’ in London, the birthplace of Mod.
 
The Mod phenomenon has touched the hearts and souls of so many people and is still influencing fashion, music, art and culture in the 21st century. This event is a celebration of 50 years of Mod not from its mysterious birth but when it swept across the whole of Britain. Since then it has reinvented itself time and time again to each new generation in keeping with the spirit of its pioneers and originators.

The four day event over the Easter Holidays 2014 will showcase all aspects of Mod music and culture spanning the last six decades. The Mod scene is now truly global as this event proved ten years ago when artists and disciples from all over the World descended on London for ‘Modstock 2 - 40 Years Of Mod 

The whole festival will be filmed for a future DVD release and TV documentary so make sure you are part of this historical event!
191861257657662.name: MODSTOCK- 50 years of Mod - London, Easter 2014

Lock N Load Events present
MODA BLACK

Friday 21st March 2014
Village Underground, London

Ben Pearce
Jaymo & Andy George
No Artificial Colours
Hauswerks

TICKETS INCREASE IN PRICE FRIDAY 28TH FEBRUARY AT MIDDAY:
http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?556403&p=modablack

In just three years, Jaymo & Andy George's Moda Black record label has positioned itself as one of the world's most exciting imprints for forward-thinking electronic music. With a firm focus on high quality production and mould-busting ideas, the label has helped break artists such as Hot Since 82 and Mia Dora, as well as pushing established powerhouses such as Eats Everything, Danny Daze and Groove Armada. Alongside monthly EP releases, the annual Moda Black albums have received widespread acclaim, whilst the tail end of 2013 saw the launch of their new artist-lead project Little Black Book. In short, Moda Black is firing on all cylinders and 2014 looks set to be their biggest year yet. 

After a stack of roadblock London parties, the Moda Black boys will be back in the capital this March, for a one-night-only affair at the formidable Village Underground. To ensure maximum perspiration, J&AG have combined forces with Purp & Soul frontman Ben Pearce, MadTech's tag-team champions No Artificial Colours, and rising Moda Black star, and all-round groove connoisseur, Hauswerks. No ass will remain unshaken! 

Village Underground, 54 Holywell Lane, Shoreditch, London, EC2A 3PQ
Open from 10.00pm – 4.00am
Fully licensed bar until close
Nearest Tube: Old Street (Northern Line) / Liverpool Street (Hammersmith & City / Metropolitan / Circle Lines)

206786409532565.description:
As in life, music has a way to move you, shake you, bring you up and make you dance. This is London Calling, the all new Monthly event to be hosted at the amazing UNION. We will not only have America's best but Artist's from around the world. Our goal is simple: to provide a VIBE to dance and enjoy all night long. Our mission is to expand the ever growing sound of Garage, UK House and 2 Step Genre's. What we as a collective of artist's have decided is to put focus on the music and the Vibe. Just for fun we will be doing Live Broadcast's at each and every London Calling from 12-2 AM with one of our partners so those that can not make the show can dance at home or work. 

THIS MONTH WE FEATURE ONE OF THE WORLDS BEST: 

*********** DOORLY - LONDON *****************
              www.soundcloud.com/doorly
                www.twitter.com/doorlydj
               www.facebook.com/doorlydj

TOOLROOM, FOOD MUSIC, IBIZA ROCKS , RINSEFM 

    Producer, DJ, Radio Presenter, Promoter...... Musical polymath, Doorly seems to have already ticked off a lot of the things on any DJ's Bucket List.  Djing in Time Square New York, Touring regularly alongside his Hero & Inspiration in Fatboy Slim, Recording TWO BBC Radio 1 Essential Mixes, Producing and DJing Live for Usher & Nicki Minaj, and sharing the stage with the Prodigy to 65,000 people (Twice!).

    Over the next 5 Years Doorly went on to do a series of musically versatile remixes for Acts including Kanye West, The Prodigy, Dizzee Rascal, Basement Jaxx, Play right across the world at all the major festivals and Become a Resident & Stage Host for Ibiza Weekly stalwart Ibiza Rocks. Also Doorly would find himself in the studio with another inspiration of his in Grandmaster Flash working on music together.

Now a UK export, Doorly relocated to Los Angeles, California at the end of 2012 and has been busy and rapidly rising Stateside over the winter, creating an array of huge parties ranging from sunshine house and disco gatherings on the rooftops of Austin at SXSW with his UK crew Skream, Toddla T and Jackmaster, to headlining 2000 capacity ‘secret’ warehouse parties in Downtown LA , As well as simultaneously programming and co-ordinating his events back in the UK & Ibiza in the meantime.
 
Doorly's Los Angeles ‘Boom Boom Room’ Studios are now fully up and running and he has been working hard honing and fine tuning a more streamlined 4x4 Sound. Early 2013 saw the release of nostalgia evoking ‘new school’ piano house track “Rush” on Diplo's LA based mega label “Mad Decent”. “Rush” went also down a storm in the UK, gaining full sweeping support from Radio 1’s first lady Annie Mac and some of the biggest in the game prompting a new signing and worldwide re-release by Mark Knight's Toolroom records over the summer alongside a host of new more underground House tracks on his Boom Boom Room EP series 1 & 2 which have gained love from Richie Hawtin, Loco Dice, Pete Tong & Fatboy Slim, Cajmere, Justin Martin, Huxley & Groove Armada to name a few.  On the second EP his tracks “I want you to dance” & “Cant Stop The Feeling” once again had widespread Radio 1 Love from Annie Mac & Tong but also sat pretty in and around the top 10 Beatport Deep House chart for over a month.

Alongside a fresh arsenal of original tracks now set for release across the summer, Doorly was honoured to be asked to officially remix Armand Van Helden’s ultimate dance classic ‘You Don’t Know Me’ and also the Seminal Steve Silk Hurley record - Jack Your Body, a track that gained full support from Claude Vonstroke, Seth Troxler, Skream, Eats Everything, Justin Martin, Catz & Dogz and was release through Steve silk’s S&S records in conjunction with Toolroom.  And has just Officially remixed Claude Vonstroke’s “The Clapping Track” due for release on Dirtybird in April.

 
Besides his solo production work, Doorly this summer  released the first track “Dissapearer” (featuring Scissor Sister Jake Shears) Via his new collaboration project ‘AVEC” which he has formed with close friend Simon Bird (Dave Spoon/ Shadow Child).  AVEC are set to release a host of fun and fresh house music through Southern Fried Records featuring some amazing guest artists. Doorly has a long standing relationship and love for Southern Fried and recently mixed the latest ‘Southern Fried & Tested’ compilation in July and is currently mixing the next Toolroom Knights Compilation due out in May.

This year will mark Doorly’s seventh season on the White Isle of Ibiza (his second home) and his continued love and commitment to the islands parties is apparent in his extensive gig schedule with almost 60 dates played in the Balearics already booked in for this summer. Including dates at the iconic “We Love Sundays” parties at Space and of course a return to his Ibiza family at Ibiza Rocks for both their Wednesday and Friday W.A.R (We Are Rockstars) Shows as DJ & Stage Host as well as a nice scattering of other parties across the island.  Also new for 2013 we saw the launch of the “Doorly and Friends” boat parties which ran weekly on Fridays with some of the hottest line ups ever to be seen at sea!

Doorly’s dedication to the craft of DJing remains paramount, with sets being played out across four CDJs, plus a samplers / FX units he is a firm believer that a DJ set should be a live turntablism experience. Doorly continues to work alongside Pioneer as one of its Pro-DJ Ambassadors and is directly involved with testing, design and training with Pioneer DJ equipment together with fellow DJ witches James Zabiela, Zane Lowe, Eats Everything and Laidback Luke.

208109436066007.description:
It's true! If you don't ask you don't get as is the opposite so true! 

I have not pushed this thus far as i have friends also running the race with targets they have to achieve to enter....which i have not.


Please go to www.justgiving.com/smedgey1

Please donate or share my page. Scope is the charity i am running on behalf of for Virgin Media.

I don't have target as i am running for Virgin Media however please share or if you'd like to donate feel free! 

For the 3rd year on the trot I had missed a Virgin Media place. A tongue in cheek email to the team completely changed that!

"Please could i ask if the places this year have been released - i have either missed the email or chosen to ignore it through disappointment!" "Please be aware i live in central London so if you have any drop outs please consider me - even if it's an hour before ha ha!"

“Hi Chris thank you for your email - by coincidence someone has dropped out and you were next in line so you are in!”

Panic, anxiety, sweating set in! Thankfully followed very closely by excitement!

Please support me and a great charity which helps thousands of people seriously effected by mental and physical disabilities and those supporting them in day to day, allowing living as normal a life as possible!

Thanks in advance! 

Please feel free to share

210417052502100.description:
This Friday we welcome our new host Nick Valentine to Meursault, described by Rock Royalty, Roger Taylor, as “the indefatigable prince of the London party scene”, Nick is someone who knows the London party scene inside out. The founder of private members club The Cuckoo Club and renowned for his wild experiences Tom Parker Bowles adds that “Nick has seen more dawns around the world than even the most dedicated of blackbirds. For the past 30 years, he’s been a constant and ever-welcome presence on the nocturnal scene.”
Nick has been a regular presence at all the hottest parties in town. His dominance of social soirees even defies the likes of Tamara Palmer-Tomkinson who says, “When it comes to glamorous parties, I’ve seen Nick out more times than I’ve seen myself.”

Also recent author to his first book entitled Clubs, Drugs and Canapés: A Deep Journey into the Shallows of the Night which involves an ‘attempt to recall the last 35 years of partying’.

Join the fun at the new party homestead of Nick Valentine’s debauchery, every Friday. Expect nothing less than celebrity guests, the best of the West London crowd and great music provide by DJ Julian Jay Palomba at L’etranger’s members club, Meursault.

212781248920992.description:
After the amazing turn out for our 1st anniversary party we have now turned our attention a little more closer to home. 

As you may know here at Output our key to throwing such off the hook parties has been the consistency of quality underground music. This could not be achieved without the help of our resident's that have pitched in from day dot to make our parties happen.

With June being so far away our feet have started to itch so what better way to fill in the gap than to to throw a Resident's Party!!! 

For this event we've invited our good friend's Curtis Lee from Lustrino & also Felix Abba & Jordan Diston from the Don't Get Lemon crew to come and pitch in with the fun. As always Output residents Kiddo and JJ will flying the flag and need no explanation for what they do. 
 
Special Guest... 

Flighting in from Kyoto, Japan and making his first appearance here in Birmingham we have Jun Akimoto, part of the FUSE London family, to close our party with an exclusive 2 hour set of deep dark dubby techno just the way we like it.

This is a very rare opportunity to see a true mastermind at work as he demonstrate his crazy skillz behind the turntables, unleashing some of the most exclusive underground music on the circuit to date.
https://soundcloud.com/jun-akimoto 

This will be an intense night of music not for the faint hearted but as always set within a friendly laid back environment. Attendance is a must! 

Line-up:

Jun Akimoto (FUSE London)
Kiddo Anderson
Curtis Lee (B'day Set)
JJ Mowbray
Felix Abbà
Jordan Diston

Music Policy: Deep / Techno / Minimal

Entrance : £7 Before 2:30

***********************************************************************
The Electronic Carnival for Freaks rolls into London Town.
***********************************************************************

Over years of Scotland-based residency we've had beach raves, rooftops, converted restaurants, eerie vibes, sunshine, plenty of sand, sun, rain, a phenomenal list of guest DJs, and of course the freaks, clowns and ever growing Mnvl family members that have supported us along this incredible journey. Ladies & Gentlemen, Milfs, Cowboys, Cowgirls, and all sorts of freaks, April 5th will go down as the day Minival finally hits the Big City. 

For this special date we've joint the musical talent of two of our current favourites.. 

:: RANDALL M (tINI & The Gang / KARTON)

Hailing from Miami, as a DJ and producer, Randall M has rapidly gained the support and recognition of some of today's most sought after artists, most notably tINI. After his prodigious Mnvl rooftop set facing the North Sea in 2013, we've been secretly craving for his return to the Minival booth. Expect balls deep house/techno..

https://soundcloud.com/randall-m

Brett 's calling came very early on. We can safely say his obsession and talent for electronic music married young and produced a beast of an artist. 219354674924289.description:
Cloud9 are proud to present our opening night at the Garage, London. Giving you the best in the deep and soulful House music through out the night, provided by the leading DJ's form the U.K and worldwide.

DJ SPEN 

Spen began his career at the age of 13, producing mix shows for WEBB AM in Baltimore. Even at that young age, Spen founded one of the area's first hip hop production groups, the Numarx. In 1986 they wrote and recorded a track called "Girl You Know It's True", which was later covered and made famous by Milli Vanilli.

Spen's radio career continued to grow and lead him to a radio career working at various FM radio stations in the Baltimore and Washington areas. In 1992, Spen developed a mixshow on 95.9 FM in Baltimore called the Flashback Saturday Night Dance Party. Though Spen eventually moved on from radio, the show is still a hit today, with Spen's close friend KW Griff at the helm.

Spen's production talents lead him to Basement Boys Records in 1989. With the formation of The Basement Boys record label in 1994, Spen formed Jasper Street Company, and released his first full production, A Feelin. With the Basement Boys and Jasper Street, Spen gained consistent commercial and dancefloor success, and became an in-demand remix producer. He has created remixes for some of clubland's biggest names, such as Diana Ross, Everything but the Girl, Ann Nesby, and Shaun Escoffery. While at Basement Boys, Spen partnered with Teddy Douglas, Thommy Davis and Karizma to create works that are still considered house anthems.

Having reached his full potential with Basement Boys, Spen stepped out on his own and partnered with Gary Deane to form the Code Red Record label in January 2004. He hasn't stopped moving since! Spen is still producing and making records that are sure to become legend. Spen's new venture found him back with former partners Thommy Davis and Karizma creating the successful Voodoo Ray, Nightrain and 4 the Love. Not long after the formation of Code Red, Gary Hudgins and Irvin Madden, key musicians and writers from Basement Boys days, joined Spen and Gary Deane to form a new production team called the MuthaFunkaz whose first release, "The Best I Can" shows a new side of Spen. The Muthafunkaz soon added soulful vocalist Marc Evans to the group. Code Red joined Defected Records for a partnership that would see the release of one of their earliest successes. “The Way You Love Me”, featuring Marc Evans, has gained worldwide attention and become a soulful house anthem. In 2008, the MuthaFunkaz completed production of Marc Evans' full length LP. In addition to the original group, the MuthaFunkaz now includes vocalist Sheila Ford, vocalist Biblical Jones (formerly of Jasper Street Company), drummer Robert Wright, horn player Eric Marner, and vocalist Erin Madden. In October 2010 Code Red will release the MuthaFunkaz LP entitled "The MuthaLode". The first single, "A Reason to Love" has been released and is already burning up dance floors all over the world. True to his roots, Spen formed the Spiritually Sound label, which will be sure to give Spen fans more of the gospel and inspirational house music Spen has become famous for.

With a career span of more than 20 years and his famous studio and production work, Spen has become one of the most sought-after DJs in the U.S. Spen can be found jetting off to gigs at some of the premier clubs around the world. He plays regularly in the UK, as well as France, Italy, Japan, and Australia.

Also In the main room we are excited to have U.K House and Disco legend, JOEY NEGRO who is the most well-known pseudonym of master British DJ/producer/remixer Dave Lee. Under a plethora of other monikers including Jakatta, Akabu, Doug Willis, Raven Maize, The Sunburst Band, Sessomatto, and Z Factor, Dave was one of the first artists to incorporate disco samples in house music when he began his production career in 1988. Indeed, he was in the studio making credible and outstanding British House music when many luminaries around him were still busy getting to grips with their decks. Little has changed since then and Dave is still widely regarded as one of the most commercially successful and in-demand artists on the global scene.

With full support from Rhemi, who have taken the soulful House scene by storm in the last year. Producing top quality music, and working with artist such the likes of Quentin Harris and Lynn Lockamy as well running their own Rhemi Music imprint. Soul heaven / Groove Fest resident Sy Sez will be warming proceedings up on the night to get your dancing feet going for what is going to be a amazing night of music!!

If this wasn't enough already, we have a very special Dj/Producer flying in from Balitmore,USA for an exclusive performance on the night. Full details will be announced on 30th of March.

Upstairs we take things a little deeper with some of London's most renowned underground Dj's in the form of Rap Saunders from the legendary London night Soulmates, Jamesey from Making Moves,Leon Paul of Nyumba Deep and last but not least Shaun Ashby and Joshua Allen from Fused Records.

220276478182191.description:
Hi all,

As many of you already know, on Sunday 13th April (next weekend) I'll be running the London Marathon.

Training started back in November and was all going swimmingly until 8 weeks ago when I picked up a knee injury.

I've managed to fumble my way through training over these final 8 weeks and I'm pleased to say that I'll still be lining up at the start line. My ability to achieve the time I want has probably gone but I'm determined to get around the 26.2 mile course regardless.

I'm raising money for Asthma UK so if you'd like to sponsor me for this gruelling challenge you can do so at the following link:

http://uk.virginmoneygiving.com/MarkMayor

Alternatively, if you'd prefer to do it the old fashioned way with a pen & paper I have a sponsorship form so just get in touch with me and we can sort it out.

The London Marathon is always one of the best days out in London and this year it doesn't look like being any different with Mo Farah running his first marathon and the weather currently forecast at 15 degrees and sunny. It'd be great to see as many of you there as possible whether you're supporting or abusing me. The below attachment takes you to a Spectators Guide showing you the route. It also gives some more info about each section of the course as well as the pubs en route.

http://static.london-marathon.co.uk/uploads/marathon-centre/2014-online-spec-guide.pdf

I'm heading to the expo on Thursday to pick up my number etc so let me know if you intend to come and watch on Sunday and I'll pick up a route map and drop it over to you. I'll also make up a little pace guide so you'll have a good idea of the exact time that I'll be passing each mile marker. On race day the London Marathon website will also have a tracker button meaning you'll be able to see my progress. If you do come along on the day, the best thing to do will be to text me where you are on the course (between miles x & y) and what side of the road you will be on to me. That way I'll be able to work my way over towards that side of the road to give you the best chance of spotting me and me seeing you!

I'm thinking about heading for a celebratory drink in and around Fenchurch St after I've finished so would be great to see you and thank you for your support. Let me know if you're interested in doing that and I'll arrange something.

If you have any questions don't hesitate in firing them across to me. Thanks for all of your support!!

Much love,

Mark/Biscuit/MJ
xx
220276478182191.name: Mark/Biscuit/MJ is running the London Marathon

CROSSFIRE started back in 2001 bringing together all the different elements of the London 60s scene for a big night of pure vintage underground partying.

In the main ballroom with huge wooden dancefloor the history of NORTHERN SOUL hosted by Kent Records and 6TS promoter and DJ Ady Croasdell. Expect the classiest Northern oldies from the Twisted Wheel, The Torch, Wigan Casino, Stafford & The 100 Club from top jocks Ginger Taylor, Mick H, Mick Smith and Chris Dale joining Harboro Horace.

The R&B ROOM is hosted by MOUSETRAP allnighter Special guest DJ's Callum Simpson & Alan Handscombe join the resident Chris Dale, Lee Miller & Rob Bailey with authentic Rhythm and Blues, Ska/Reggae and Club Soul on the menu. 

The BEAT BASEMENT with resident DJ Dr Robert (Le Beat Bespoke) and International guests spin the primest 60’s Beat, Garage, Psych committed to vinyl. Expect maximum fun, gorgeous go-go girls to a backdrop of kaleidoscopic visuals and the best live acts.

Nerd Rage - Tampa, FL (Subhuman / Ultragore)

FB
https://www.facebook.com/NerdRage.music

SoundCloud
https://soundcloud.com/nerdrage

Nerd Rage's music, hand-in-hand with his stage presence, is loud, aggressive, and right in your face. Never taking himself too seriously, Nerd Rage continues to deliver good vibes whether he’s behind the decks or in front of his computer. The phenom has developed some serious production skills as well as respect throughout the Bass Music community since exploding onto the scene last year, and demonstrates his progress every step of the way.

Nerd Rage has quickly risen to the top of the heap beginning with his first single, "Real Life," hiting top 10 on the Beatport charts. One of the tracks was also featured at number one on Beatport's "Top 10 Must Hear Dubstep Tracks."

Korn Frontman Jonathan Davis also listed the track, “Dark Crystal,” as one of his top 5 favorite EDM songs for Revolver Magazine.

His tunes can now be heard on dancefloors and radio around the world, with top DJs such as Terravita, Dirtyphonics, Evol Intent, Pendulum, Excision, Funtcase, Datsik, Downlink, SKisM, Bare, and Dieselboy playing his musical creations.

Type R Ryan Type R

10k Lumens of front and rear projection mapping

224145747793783.description:
No pop, no commercial dance. Just cutting-edge house music.

*Please note that WRONG! is a mixed gay/straight party. Be nice or you won't get in. We're being strict on this*

The party that everyone talked about through 2013, that transformed Saturday morning clubbing in Vauxhall, WRONG! has built its reputation as Vauxhall's biggest, busiest, best Saturday morning afterhours party on the firm foundations of our friendly welcoming crowd and cutting-edge tech house.

Always the friendliest welcome in Vauxhall (it's more like a family!), our established team of hosts are always on hand to welcome you on arrival: Robbie, Andy and Luis!

We open 2:30am Saturday morning and close around 1pm - often later!

£7 with a flyer, MOTD, ROAR. Get there early to avoid the queue.

The WRONG! residents this week:

Steven Sharp
Jamie de Rooy
Thomas Wonderland
Enrico Chirchiello

About our DJs:

STEVEN SHARP
With literally hundreds of productions and remixes under his belt as part of the Sharp Boys, and a good couple of decades tearing up the dancefloors, Steven Sharp has been at the forefront of the house music scene for a long time. He's promoted some of London's biggest parties, and played some of the world's biggest. Steven joined us as our new resident in January 2013 to play a great underground tech house set.
http://www.mixcloud.com/WRONG_Club/steven-sharp-at-wrong-17-august-2013/


JAMIE DE ROOY
Jamie de Rooy has for the past few years been bringing the London sound to Spain through his twice-weekly peak-hour mix show through Barcelona's premier dance music radio station, Styl FM. Jamie's supercharged tech house sets rock WRONG's parties, and will bring you up and then keep you on a peak til you can't dance anymore.
http://www.mixcloud.com/jamiederooy/

THOMAS WONDERLAND
Thomas is Wrong's Corsican import, and he's been partying since he was 13. Ibiza, Spain, London, France, Thailand, Goa - his travels have informed his music. WRONG! was one of the first club nights Thomas played, and we're delighted to have secured him as one of our forward-thinking residents.
https://soundcloud.com/thomas-wonderland

ENRICO CHIRCHIELLO
Enrico was born in Montreal, Canada in 1992 and moved to Italy at the age of 7. As a young boy he was already passionate about music and by the age of 13 he started DJing with turntables in small local clubs. Enrico has always been influeced and inspired by South American sounds. The style of music he DJs is predominantly Techno House. In 2011 he, with close friend Luca Donofrio, created a dual-owned record label called Mad System Brothers. That same year the two decided to move to London, for better opportunities, to meet new people and play in big clubs. In his endeavour to promote his DJing style and music, he has been resident at, and played in, a number of clubs in London. As his latest venture, Enrico has created and run his own events organisation called Last Drop, where he involves guest DJs and invites friends for a night of good music with a great ambiance. He has released tracks on labels like: Mr Ambrose Recordings, Finish Team Record, Housebeat Record, Black Eye Records, Jintonik Records, WOD Limited, Code2 Records, Beach Music Records, Celestial Recordings.
https://soundcloud.com/enrico-chirchiello
224145747793783.name: WRONG! London's biggest, busiest and best Saturday morning afterhours!

225502614318907.description:
TICKETS NOW AVAILABLE FOR rare UK cinema premiere of Caribbean film.

"Keeping Up With The Joneses: The Movie" 
 - based on the popular TV series from Barbados.

London screening 6pm on 27 March 2014 at the Picturehouse Cinema in Stratford.

TICKET PRICES : 
  ADULTS - £6.50
  STUDENTS - £5.00
  RETIREES (60+)  - £5.00
                
Online tickets via http://bit.ly/1hZIFyB 
Phone 08719-025740 or 
Visit the cinema box office in person between 1pm and 9pm at Salway Road, E15 1BX (next to the Theatre Royal).

Including all your favourite characters from the TV series, "KUWTJ: The Movie" is centred around the fictional Jones family (father Irving, mother Angela, daughter Tracy and son Nathan) who became famous after featuring in a TV reality show. Life is going well but when the Joneses are kidnapped at a family picnic, all seems to be lost. But hope is at hand when Angela's brother and three of his friends from a local institution go on a mission to save them.
 
This comedy-thriller is well scripted and sympathetically portrayed - thrills and laughs abound!

This will be the first cinema premiere of a Caribbean film in the UK for 2014 and the first British official cinema screening of a full feature film from Barbados ever!

See the trailer for the film: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rLfHpfODB9M

See the audience reaction: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YmNOinl19kk

More info here: www.sankofa-tv.co.uk

La Bibiche London and OuToPlay Movement colliding into a new House Music project which due to be launched from the ultimate night life platform of central London - The Cuckoo Club. This Thursday, 27th of March, get ready to be amazed by the best set of players in town on the night.
 
Our special guests, LOVERDOSE are rapidly establishing themselves internationally as great electronic music producers. Both these artists, Gepy & Levan aka LOVERDOSE have over 10 years experience in producing and playing all around the world: Ibiza, Tokyo, Moscow, Rome, Kiev and all main London clubs. Everything started casually after a cool Boat Party on the Thames. After a few studio Sessions, they both realised that as a Duo they have a unique Sound, so LOVERDOSE was born during the Summer of 2011. Their first release “Tabula Rasa” instantly became a classic of electronic music with support from music lovers around the World and more than a million hits on Youtube.

Their Back to Back partner on the night is our good friend, producer and the member of multiple record labels around US and UK, representative of ReSolute Label - JOE LE GROOVE, experience and solid style of play, Groove is not only is in his name, it's everything about his style of play and producing the music. The latest collaboration with international DJ and producer tINI has brought them to the top 10 chart positions of the Tech House Music on Beatport. Internationally loved and entirely cool, he'll deliver the best sound you can think of!

Supported by La Bibiche and OuToPlay Movement residents, Julian Meinke and jeFF Fury. 

starting the groove from 10.30pm till early hours of Friday

228742303975552.description:
Lock N Load Events present
BEDROCK
Easter Thursday 17th April
Fire & Lightbox, London
http://www.bedrock.org.uk
http://www.johndigweed.com

FIRE:
John Digweed (6 hour set)
Ripperton

LIGHTBOX:
Gregor Tresher (OFFICIAL)
Harvey McKay
Darren Emerson
Eagles & Butterflies

PROTOCOL: Subculture
Dubspeeka
Blue Amazon
Matt Tanner & Grant Nichols
Neil Browne 

CLICK HERE FOR TICKETS:
http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?559065&p=bedrockeaster

Having enjoyed a storming start to 2014 with a sold out event at Shoreditch’s Village Underground, John Digweed’s Bedrock returns to London for the imprint’s traditional Easter celebrations on Thursday 17th April. Taking place at the subterranean hideout that is Vauxhall’s Fire & Lightbox, Bedrock will showcase three rooms of house and techno. With some of the scenes most exciting players showcased in the Capital over the past fifteen years, Bedrock will again leave no stone unturned and deliver a forward-thinking line-up which encapsulates a wide spectrum of sounds.

At Easter Bedrock John Digweed will deliver another timeless journey through his trademark beats via an extended six hour main room set alongside some very special guests. This bespoke collection of artists are either signed to Bedrock Records or long time favourites of John and all will reflect the imprints underground ethos. This will be John’s second visit to the Capital this year following the sold out Village Underground event. His headline performance at Bedrock is the ideal platform through which to see this master at work and is certainly not to be missed.

As one of house music’s finest producers, we are delighted to welcome Ripperton to Bedrock for the very first time. Firmly established as a true ambassador of dark and melodic beats, Ripperton’s most recent studio output has been in the form of his second album ‘A Little Part Of Shade’, three track EP ‘77’ and a Robert Babicz remix. The immersive techno and refined house prevalent in these productions have proven hugely popular in his sets at Europe’s seminal nightclubs and it’s with great excitement that we look forward to Ripperton’s Bedrock debut.  

In the Lightbox Bedrock welcomes one of the most sought after female DJs currently residing on the house circuit, the magnificent Kim Ann-Foxman. Having built a globetrotting schedule from her own DJ and production pursuits, Kim can be found touring the world’s finest clubs and festivals. Her sound boasts intense and chunky grooves placed on top of raw and directive basslines as evident in her recent collaborations with Maya Jane Coles and KiNK. Having delivered standout performances at The Warehouse Project and Fabric, we welcome the Big Apple’s finest to Bedrock as she intoxicates the Lightbox with her infectious sounds.

Kim will be joined by one of electronic music’s hottest prospects, Harvey Mckay. Harvey is a name that has continued to rise thanks to a reputation for one-off originals, killer remixes and energetic DJ sets. His powerful productions have been released on labels including Drumcode, Bedrock, Soma, Saved and Cocoon, with his ‘Lost’ EP continuing to dominate Beatport’s techno chart three months after its release. With his new EP ‘Illusion of Control’ set to have a similar impact, Harvey’s debut performance at Bedrock is set to be a true highlight on Thursday 17th April.

As one of the most influential figures dance music has ever seen, Darren Emerson’s history has been well documented; a former member of Underworld and producer of one of the greatest tracks ever in 'Born Slippy', he also captured the public’s imaginations with dancefloor anthem 'Scorchio' (with Sasha) plus unforgettable remixes for The Chemical Brothers and Björk. More recently, Emerson’s debut Bedrock release ‘Hotdog’ and EP on Hotflush (as ‘The White Lamp’) has caused huge waves. Joining us off the back of a Japanese Tour as well as performances in India, Australia and Argentina, Bedrock please welcome Darren Emerson. 

Also playing the Lightbox following his outstanding performance at the fifteenth anniversary party, is one of 2013’s breakthrough artists Eagles & Butterflies. Since emerging onto the scene, E&B has come a long way in establishing himself. Having gained significant interest by spinning at Space Ibiza’s Clandestin party throughout last summer, Eagles & Butterflies’ latest studio offering, the ‘SYW003’ EP will be released on his own imprint, Spread Your Wings. Joining us ahead of the release of his debut artist album, ‘The Butterfly Effect’, Eagles & Butterflies completes the Lightbox lineup brilliantly, thanks to his forward-thinking track selection and superb technical ability. 

Elusive Bristol based producer Dubspeeka, who recently debuted on Oliver Huntemann's Ideal Audio label, headlines the Protocol room hosted by Subculture. Having impressed with an array of releases over the past twelve months, on labels such as Bedrock, Truesoul, Hope and on his very own Skeleton imprint, he's now focussed on exploring the full spectrum of electronic music under his Dubspeeka alias. Exciting many of the underground's elite over the last year with his distinctive sound, his tunes are driven by the heaviest of basslines and kick-drums, plus a dark and industrial edge.

Completing the bill for Bedrock’s Easter showcase is Blue Amazon. His direct approach to mixing allows him to dive deep into the realms of tech house and techno to energize and stimulate the crowd. Blue Amazon’s performances are always seamless, building dynamically from melodic basslines to high-energy techno beats. Having originally developed from his hip-hop based roots, Blue Amazon’s technical ability to manipulate effects, loops and everything in between is second to none and has been evident in his previous sets alongside the likes of John Digweed, Sasha and Danny Howells to name a few.

Fire, South Lambeth Road, London, SW8 1RT
Open from 10.00pm – 7.00am
Fully licensed bar until close
Nearest Tube: Vauxhall (Victoria Line)

So... it's fair to say we've been pretty damn quiet for the last few years while on 'hiatus', busy with our own individual bands / career paths... but you know what? 230798443788040.description:
Day Drunk is competing in CBC's Searchlight Contest with the chance to win 20,000$ and a festival gig! Please help support us by voting every day and getting others to vote as well.

VOTE HERE: http://music.cbc.ca/artists/Day-Drunk

Voting for Regional Top 25 takes place March 24th-April 6th 3PM

Voting for Regional Top 10 runs April 7th-13th






 "We've chosen the song The Stories We Will Tell  for CBC's Searchlight not only because of it's original meaning but because it's meaning grows with the ever growing story of our lives. The song was written telling the story of my housemates who helped me through a lot, and are closer to me than brothers. The narrative that is told throughout the song are real events from my life that I hold dear. The opening line "I watch the stars with a million other people" is inspired by a tattoo my housemate has. The tattoo was meant as a reminder that no matter where he is, he is always looking at the same night sky as his loved ones, which would help bring comfort on long outdoor trips. This was a sentiment shared with him by his father, which inspired him to get the tattoo. I use the line to express that even though one day when we all are off living our separate lives, we can always be brought back together by looking up at the stars. One night in particular he was outside looking up at the stars, and myself and the other housemates came out to join him. We talked of our friendship and about how one day, it'll be these moments, these stories, that we will share of each other to our children.


I could come home after the shittiest of days and within minutes of being home, I would feel like everything would be alright. The fact that I landed in a house with these guys was entirely by happenstance, which inspired the line that the pieces just seem to have fallen into place.

The bridge is meant as a toast to life, and living it to the fullest and not being afraid to give love. I've lost friends to suicide, and to think that they didn't know the love I had for them is a mistake I never want to have happen again. Love is indeed worth giving and life is worth living, if only for the precious moments we share with even more precious people.

They say these are the best years of our lives and I believe it, and knowing I can look up at the night sky and be back in these moments with such wonderful people, I know I'll never have to truly say farewell.

But as I said before, the song's meaning grows with every new story. The story of the band coming together itself was really random as well. I saw a poster for McMaster's Last Band Standing, and figured since I'd always wanted to do something like that, that I should go for it. Marty was an acquaintance who was a friend of my housemates. Rhett was his housemate and joined the band once we jammed with him. Now I couldn't ask for two better friends to be sharing the stage with, and doing what we love to do, playing music. We recently competed in LCBO's Whiskey Rocks and got to open for Theory of a Deadman, which was unreal, but the most incredible thing was getting to rock out on that stage and just have fun with two great buddies. Our main band photo is actually from that show, and we decided that Stories would be one of our songs for that set because that moment would in fact be a story we would tell. The photo was taken perfectly fittingly during the bridge, which as I said is a toast to life, we asked the audience to toast with us and the crowd of two thousand people toasted with us.

We're so grateful to our unbelievable friends, families and fans who have really gotten our music out there and have given us huge opportunities like that.

We've only been a band for just over a year but are already getting airplay around college radio, with our debut EP charting on CFMU's Chart Top 30 for 7 weeks, peaking at #4. 

Lastly, what I find so wonderful is that everyone has stories they will tell, of the moments and the people that have impacted their lives, and I hope that this song inspires people to think of those memories."

- Jordan Hallin

In November Cocoon returned for a sell out show at Building Six, making North Greenwich feel a little like Ibiza and left us dreaming of Mediterranean sunrises. This spring Cocoon returns with a medley of producers that have consistently been at the forefront of the European DJ circuit. Joining talisman Sven Vath in the main room will be Tim Green whose reverberated himself through the realms of house and techno with a distinctive charm.

Calling on the very capable mixing fingers of mobilee records to go up against in the Cocoon posse in room 2; label owners Anja Schneider and Ralf Kollmann will be representing the Berlin based outfit. Battling against Timo Maas this will be Anja’s first set in London since she tore apart the Tobacco Dock New Year’s Day party. Seeking only inspiration from the world’s best clubs has allowed Tim Maas to create a sound that’s direct and gripping. Reflecting exactly the mindset of what Cocoon has always been.

Dear Students,
This is your Capitant speaking!

London is the capital of the business world and many young people aspire to work in this vibrant city. That is why Capitant gives its members the opportunity to visit some of London's oldest financial institutions. Explore its gleaming new walkways, hallowed halls and appealing outdoor spaces and discover the underlying history of our love affair with trading. Our range of Business visits includes some of the world's best-known companies as well as the banks and stock exchanges of the world's leading economic centres: 
- BlackRock
- Aberdeen
- Bloomberg
- Lloyds of London
- Morningstar
- Rabobank
- ..

Capitant offers you this amazing trip for just € 250! This includes the following things:
- All transport (train and public transport)
- Accommodation in the heart of London
- A big surprise event on Thursday evening
- London's nightlife
- And much more !

We will leave on Wednesday the 2nd of April in the afternoon and return is scheduled on Saturday evening the 5th of April.

During these couple of days, you will receive tours, company presentations, details for a potential application, an extensive Q&A session and networking opportunities

HOW CAN I APPLY?
You can apply by sending an e-mail to financetrip@capitant.be and attaching your CV in annex. 
Note that we do not screen CV's on their content, although they will be delivered to our partners in London so make sure your CV is error-free. (Yes, we will check on grammar and spelling)

WHEN CAN I APPLY?
For Master-students, applications will open on the 12th of November at 7:00 PM.
For Bachelor-students, applications will open on the 18th of November at 7:00 PM.

Please note that applications received before this date will not be considered.

Intake is limited to 25 students in each city, so early application is advised.

If you have any more questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at financetrip@capitant.be.

We look forward to welcoming you on our trip!
Capitant 2013-2014

For an Easter Thursday special we’ve invited Axel Boman to join us in celebrating our 7th birthday party! 

The dark, base-fueled ‘Purple drank’ became the breakthrough track for Swedish dj/producer Axel Boman. In 2010 he moved to London becoming the newest student at the Red Bull Music Academy. Alongside Kornél Kovács & Petter Nordkvist their lovechild was born, Studio Barnhus. 

2013 saw various releases including his debut full-length album ‘Family Vacation’ a dark, soulful mixture of deep house and groovey disco. With an extended 5am license for this special occasion, his eclectic taste of electronica will be the perfect way to welcome in the Easter weekend! 

Dance Tunnel/ 95 Kingsland High Street; Dalston; London E8 2PB

240312246150375.description:
Info & tickets: http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?555838

Derrick May /// Deetron /// Arnaldo /// Peverelist /// Kowton /// Asusu /// James Priestley /// Giles Smith @ Electric Brixton

Kicking things off in style, the party returns to South London for their annual Easter Special at Electric. After sell out shows there with Nina Kraviz last Spring and Levon Vincent this NYE, they come with a typically heritage-meets-cutting-edge line-up that makes it a must go to event for any discerning house and techno fan alike.

Headlining the event is none other than Derrick May, Detroit innovator and famously part of the Belleville 3 alongside Juan Atkins and Kevin Saunderson. Spanning a career of decades and responsible for various classic productions along the way, Derrick is now most renowned for his prowess as a DJ and is a man still very much at the top of his game. Effortlessly combining a raw funk backbone with a smoother more hypnotic sensibility, his set for secretsundaze last year at the Opening Party at Studio 338 was the highlight of our summer so we cant wait to welcome him back, but this time, presenting him in a different scenario, as we witness the damage he can do in a packed theatre house with disco lights.

Co-headlining is Swiss veteran Deetron, whose skills as both a producer and as a technically genius 3-turntable DJ, has earned him a unique position in the world of house and techno, fiercely independent, and not aligned to any particular crew or label. His stock has steadily risen and now, whilst inspiring a new generation of young artists along the way, is one of the most in-demand DJs out there. These skills can be heard on his highly rated Balance CD compilation and most recently his natural flair in the studio 'Music Over Matter', his second artist album. Many of Deetron's roots are in Detroit techno so he was our first choice to pair alongside Derrick May for an enticing US / European meeting of minds..

As a 3rd guest in the main room we welcome rising star, Argentinian but London based Arnaldo, who has steadily been carving a reputation as one of a new wave of serious deep house artists emerging from the city. Playing only the coolest spots and often publishing his long live sets online to much acclaim from the heads, he is also more than handy in the studio, recording for esteemed labels such as Lawrence's Smallville and Blank Slate no less.

As ever, secretsundaze founders James Priestley and Giles Smith will be on residential duties, warming up and rounding off proceedings as only they know how.

Taking over Room 2 is one of favourite labels right now, Bristol based Livity Sound. The union of artists Peverelist, Kowton & Asusu is releasing some of the most forward thinking music out there, taking inspiration from dub, jungle and crucially techno. They are at the forefront of a new wave of UK labels exploring these crossroads. The results are formidable, rightfully earning them the highly respected accolade of Top Label of 2013 on Resident Advisor. Their string of vinyl only releases have been charted by some of the world's most adventurous DJs, but it was the Livity Sound CD compilation that has transcended them onto the lips of any UK electronic music lover worth their salt.

Early bird tickets are now on sale exclusively through Resident Advisor.
240312246150375.name: Secretsundaze Easter Special - DERRICK MAY, DEETRON, ARNALDO, PEVERELIST, KOWTON, ASUSU, JAMES PRIESTLEY & GILES SMITH @ Electric Brixton, London

— YUNG LEAN (Live)

"Yung Lean is a beguiling mishmash of American hip-hop’s more peculiar, Lil B-indebted elements, and he raises a lot of questions. Mainly, who the fuck is this kid? And why is he like this?" - Noisey
http://bit.ly/1e7ArAS

"Yung Lean, despite all the rap posturing, is really making outsider music – this is his deeply Scandinavian take on a sound he has about as much in common with as he does the Delta blues, and it doesn’t seem to matter. Like Riff Raff before him, Lean appears oblivious to these concerns, and has quickly and quietly cut-and-pasted himself a rap career replete with a crew (The Sad Boys), a sound (cloud rap via Japan), and a look (very young, very white)." - FACT

"Yung Lean has styled himself somewhere between Lil' B and Chief Keef" - VIBE

— PIFF GANG (Live)

"This is weird. Good weird, but weird nonetheless. Piff Gang are Londoners doing what, as far as we know, no one from the capital has done before: offered a UK version of the torpid, hazy, woozy, luxuriantly produced hip-hop we've been raving about these past few years." - Guardian

* * *

Cirque Du Soul is a travelling collective energy of colour, magic and dance. Only the most vibrant and open-minded party goers need apply. The 21st Century’s Moulin Rouge - burlesque meets bass. It's time for you to know about Cirque Du Soul.

Once a month we will invade the most quirky of hideouts in a selected city, dusting out the cobwebs, chalking up the cocktail menu and sweeping the stage for a sell-out showdown of bohemian madness.

The air will be soaked with the freshest collection of house, funk, soul, electro-swing, disco, garage and hip-hop this side of Chicago. Each city bags its own headliner - and the junkies can hop skip and jump to the next performance with our travelling troupe.. but space is limited.

You have to play by the rules of the circus. Visual delights welcomed. Long tails and corsets, top hats and canes, glitter, sequins and feathers, blacks, reds, golds - the boys dress up and the girls dress down.

Goldfish Live in London!

Goldfish: Three Second Memory Tour @ Electric Brixton
 
Multi-instrumentalist electronic wunderkinds Goldfish return to London to perform their explosive live show at the Electric Brixton on Sunday 20th April (Monday is a Bank Holiday)

Their genre-defying mix of live saxophones, double bass, keyboards and pounding house beats has touched a nerve with audiences across the world, performing everywhere from Ultra Music Festival to Pacha Ibiza. Rather than bash out boring loops in Ableton this duo build their sounds from the bottom up using a wide selection of live instruments to create a live show which leaves audiences gobsmacked around the world.

For this very special London show they will be joined by the Berlin based young talent Wankelmut - known for his rolling Techno plus hits One Day Reckoning and My head is a Jungle ft. Emma Louise. Wankelmut’s support will ensure the dance floor is nicely warmed all night long. Expect a massive night out with the very best in Music, Visuals, Lighting, Sound and SFX at one of London’s premiere venues.

246328388883763.description:
A series of 32 talks on famous Londoners curated by Suzette Field of A Curious Invitation and Antique Beat will take place on the EDF Energy London Eye on May 1st 2014. 

In the fifteen years since it was first built the London Eye has come to be regarded as perhaps the capital's most iconic landmark.  So what more fitting place could there be to host a series of thirty-two talks on some of the men and women who helped make London one of the world's pre-eminent cities? 

On May 1st 2014 the London Eye will be set to a special slow rotation speed and each of its 32 capsules will be given over to a talk by a well-known authority on a famous Londoner. The subjects will range from Thomas Becket to Joseph Bazalgette, from WS Gilbert to Ray Davies and from Queen Victoria to Zadie Smith. The lecturers themselves will be a roll call of those who have contributed to the capital's cultural legacy: from former Mayor of London Ken Livingstone, to ex-Poet Laureate Andrew Motion, film director Julien Temple, broadcaster Robert Elms and biographers Claire Tomalin and Kate Williams. 

As you soar high over two thousand years of London's history in the hands of our expert guides what better insight could you have into the lives and works of the influential figures who have shaped the heritage, culture and image of our ancient and celebrated capital? 

To commemorate the occasion Hendrick's Gin have devised 32 bespoke cocktails, one in honour of each London borough. Each guest will be served a complimentary cocktail of their choice during the lecture. After disembarkation there will be an opportunity to share a drink with your fellow participants and speakers and discuss this singular and inspirational event. 

32 Londoners has been curated by a Curious Invitation and Antique Beat as a unique experience intended to strengthen the cultural connection of Londoners with the city in which they live and work.

THE TALKS

Anne Duggan on THOMAS BECKET - Saint, b. 1118 Cheapside
Henry Eliot on GEOFFREY CHAUCER - Poet, b.1343 London
Dan Cruickshank on JOHN STOW - Historian, b. 1525 Cornhill
Claire Tomalin on SAMUEL PEPYS - Diarist, b. 1633 Fleet Street
Martin Rowson on WILLIAM HOGARTH - Satirist, b. 1697 Clerkenwell
Ian Kelly on BEAU BRUMMELL - Dandy, b. 1778 St James
Matt Brown on MICHAEL FARADAY - Scientist, b. 1791 Southwark
Sir Andrew Motion on JOHN KEATS - Poet, b. 1795 Moorgate
Kate Williams on QUEEN VICTORIA - Monarch, b. 1819 Kensington
Stephen Halliday on JOSEPH BAZALGETTE - Engineer, b. 1819 Enfield
Martin Lamb on WS GILBERT - Composer, b. 1836 The Strand
Essie Fox on MARIE LLOYD - Singer, b. 1870 Hoxton
Geoffrey Beare on WILLIAM HEATH ROBINSON - Cartoonist, b. 1872 Finsbury Park
Charles Elford on SAMUEL COLERIDGE-TAYLOR - Composer, b. 1875 Holborn
Ken Livingstone on HERBERT MORRISON - Politician, b. 1888 Stockwell
Bryony Dixon on CHARLIE CHAPLIN - Actor, b. 1889 Walworth
Nathalie Morris on ALFRED HITCHCOCK - Film Director, b. 1899 Leytonstone
D J Taylor on EVELYN WAUGH - Writer, b. 1903 West Hampstead
Hugo Vickers on CECIL BEATON - Photographer, b. 1904 Hampstead
Peter Berthoud on PHYLIS PEARSALL - Inventor of the A-Z, b. 1906 East Dulwich
Jude Kelly on JOAN LITTLEWOOD - Theatre director, b. 1914 Stockwell
David Stafford on LIONEL BART - Composer, b. 1930 Stepney
Kate Kray on THE KRAYS - Gangsters, b. 1933 Hoxton
Robert Elms on ADAM FAITH - Pop Star, b. 1940 Acton
Grant Fleming on BOBBY MOORE - Footballer, b. 1941 Barking
Julien Temple on RAY DAVIES - Musician, b. 1944 Muswell Hill
Geoffrey Marsh on DAVID BOWIE - Musician, b. 1947 Brixton
DJ Nihal on JAZZIE B - Music producer, b. 1963 Hornsey
Gavin Evans on LENNOX LEWIS - Boxer, b. 1965 West Ham
Jacqueline Shaw on OZWALD BOATENG - Fashion designer, b. 1967 Muswell Hill
Lesley-Ann Jones on NAOMI CAMPBELL - Model, b. 1970 Streatham
Philippa Thomas on ZADIE SMITH - Writer, b. 1975 Brent
Each ticket includes a complimentary Hendrick's Gin cocktail with a unique recipe for each of London's 32 boroughs and admission to the exclusive Featherless Flight Lounge in Jubilee Gardens next to County Hall.

Every year, the November 5th Resistance movement in the UK grows bigger and stronger. In 2011 there was 500-600 people, in 2012 there was over 1000 people, this year in 2013 there was over 2000. This Idea is not going away.. 

In 2015, we will once again march on the houses of Parliament in London , leading up to 2016 when November 5th falls on a Saturday ! The standard has now been set , next year we will have bigger banners, louder voices, more fireworks, more people and a louder sound system ! 

Why are we doing this?.... simple... Because governments need to be reminded that the people will NEVER be oppressed again. The Internet Awakening is on-going and the people will not be divided by subject, race, age or religion. We are a diverse collective of human beings fighting for overall human freedom, we will not be silenced and we will not be negotiated with, we have no leaders, only ideas ! 

We are Anonymous 
We are Legion
We do not forgive 
We do not forget
EXPECT US ...

JOIN US IN 2016 ! 

IMPORTANT: Please invite as many friends as possible ..
249587435194341.name: #OpVendetta #NOV5TH 2016 - LONDON

Hvad er bedre ved London, end deres Pub's?
2.Y vil den 22. marts give jer en gylden mulighed: 
Vi vil give jer muligheden for, at besøge en traditionel engelsk pub, her på Himmelev Gymnasium!

På pubben vil der være kolde øl, live fodbold på storskærm, bordfodbold og dart.
Vi vil sørge for en masse sjove konkurrencer, med fede præmier!
 

Kom og vær med. Nyd en kold bajer, hyg dig med fodbold, venner og familie over et sjovt spil bordfodbold eller dart. Alle er velkomne store som små!

Under arrangementet har vi "skaffet" et upcoming band kaldet "The Sizzling Sassy Sisters" bestående af Axel Illeris Poggi, Cemil Burak Altinkaya, Lasse Björn Lautrup, Simon Zangger Christiansen og Magnus Glasdam Jakobsen.
Vi vil spille et par svedige numre som i kan hygge jer til.

Så kom og hav en hyggelig eftermiddag lørdag D. 22. marts i lokale 22 (grøn hjemstavn)

256894301144064.description:
Hi, thanks for visiting my fundraising page. 

To Donate: http://www.virginmoneygiving.com/NathanViva

A few years ago after a particularly hard time for me, I made a bucket list. On that list were many things... some I have managed to do, others that are in the pipeline and some that are still just items on a list. But one of the top ones was running the London Marathon. It took me 2 years of applying and even then I just got in with only 11 weeks to go as a back up. So here I am, kinda unprepared for it all, but determined to give it my best shot. 

To let you know why you should sponsor me it might help to let you know how much of a challenge this actually is for me... Well, I have been running to keep fit as part of my kickboxing fight training for a few years now (another thing on my bucket list...) but I have never run anything further than 15km, I usually run around 5km. The Marathon is 42km. Marathon training normally requires a 24 week build up and intensive training, I have 11 weeks and haven’t run AT ALL in the previous 3months. So, as you can see... this is going to be a challenge.

Why have I chosen The Royal British Legion and why do I think that you should want to donate to them, via me? A lot of people are just happy to take part and will run for anyone that needs people to run for them. I, however, specifically chose the British Legion as they are exactly the kind of charity that I love to support. They help real people, in real need. They are not a faceless research charity, but one that helps those who have laid their lives on the line to defend the country that you most likely call home. World War II veterans in need of care, support and to know that there are people out there that appreciate the sacrifices that they made for us. Its all too common that we forget those that were part of such a pivotal moment in our history. So, my targeted £3000 will go towards wheelchairs, home care, medicine and vital care equipment to make their lives comfortable when they most need it. I am sure this now sounds like something you can feel comfortable donating towards, so for just the price of a pint (or hopefully more!) you can help. If you met some of the guys I am trying to help down the pub, and knew what they had been though for you all those years ago, you'd want to buy them a pint, wouldn’t you? So, imagine that is what you are doing... if you can afford the price of a round, and a packet of cheese & onion with some pork scratchings on the side, then wicked!

Don't forget to use the "gift aid" feature as they will give more on your behalf meaning that the target will be reached ever quicker, and more money will go to a good cause. Thank you and wish me luck!!

Through Virgin Money Giving, you can sponsor me and donations will be quickly processed and passed to charities. Virgin Money Giving is a not for profit organisation and will claim gift aid on a charity's behalf where the donor is eligible for this. I really appreciate all your support and thank you for any donations.

To Donate: http://www.virginmoneygiving.com/NathanViva
256894301144064.name: Nathan Viva Runs The London Marathon for The Royal British Legion Charity

The LSE SU London Society Presents:
The LSE London 2030 Summit 

Days: Tuesday &/ Wednesday 

Get Tickets directly from Link Above!

The London 2030 Summit is a two-day event due to be held at the London School of Economics in March 2014. It combines Ted-X and Question Time. 

The aim of the Summit is to bring together current decision makers to discuss pertinent issues regarding the future of London. 

The Summit will focus on the following four topics; 
London in the World, Business, Politics and Society and Making London Work. The Summit's parent society ‘LSE SU London Society’ is currently partnered with Google, Harvard Business Review and Boston Consulting Group.

258150851021212.description:
Lock N Load Events in association with Data Transmission presents
KÖLSCH
Thursday 10th April
Fire, London

Kölsch [Live]
Dolan Bergin (Electric Minds) 
Will Taylor

CLICK HERE FOR TICKETS:
http://firelondon.eventgenius.co.uk/events/K-lsch-Live/index.html

Kölsch returns to London for the first time this year as part of his inaugural UK headline tour. Landing at a trio of the finest underground spots the UK has to offer, Kölsch has timed this tour to precede a series of high profile summer dates and forthcoming releases. Taking place on Thursday 10th April, the first date will welcome Kölsch to London’s subterranean hideout Fire, for an intimate session of his much lauded live show. 

Since the release of his artistically brilliant album 1977 on Kompakt last June, the electronic world has been in admiration. Fittingly described as romantic techno, each of the thirteen tracks are melodic electronic anthems that leave the mind in state of euphoria. The end of the year saw Kölsch tour his beautifully crafted sound across Europe with dates in Belgium, Switzerland, Netherlands, France and Spain to name a few. Following this Kölsch opened 2014 in fine form by kicking off BBC Radio 1’s Essential Mix Future Stars with a mix that set the precedent for rising artists taking part in the internationally acclaimed series. Having gained a vast amount of support from a plethora of the world’s leading talent, it’s clear that 2014 is the year of Kölsch. 

With the next few months already shaping up nicely for the Dane, the rest of the tour will see him touch down in Manchester and Glasgow before taking on the mighty Amnesia Opening Party, Snowbombing and Mysteryland USA amongst others. With support coming from Electric Minds’ Dolan Bergin, The Willers Brothers and Will Taylor do not miss this rare opportunity to experience Kölsch at his very best.

Fire, South Lambeth Road, London, SW8 1RT
Open from: 21:00 – 01:00
Full licenced bar until close
Nearest tube: Vauxhall (Victoria Line)

264480593702970.description:
London Lunar Immersion with Jason Nemer & Erica Montes
29th March to 2nd April 2014 at Triyoga Soho 

The Lunar Immersion focuses on the healing, relaxing and rejuvenating practices of Thai massage and therapeutic flying. The Lunar Asana Sequence teaches basic body mechanics with a focus on self-love cultivation, in preparation for the dance of Thai massage. The techniques learned on the floor are then translated to the flying work, using the element of gravity to amplify the healing flow of prana (life force). Often, we will work in teams of three for safety and support, and everyone will have the opportunity to base and fly, heal and be healed. This training offers invaluable tools for yoga teachers, massage therapists, and energy workers who wish to develop a new dimension of healing touch for students or clients.
Skills Covered:
• Lunar Asana Sequence
• Thai massage in Supine, Prone, Side Lying, & Seated positions
• Forward, Backward & High Flying Whale Therapeutic Flying Sequences

The full 30 hours fulfils a prerequisite for AcroYoga Teacher Training. Please attend with your own copy of "Elements of AcroYoga" manual.

Join for the first day, the weekend or the full five days at TriYoga Soho! Follow the link below for details on half day attendance:
http://www.triyoga.co.uk/book-courses-workshops?x=1&teacher=100000423

264526997033145.description:
The Brazilian singer, songwriter and instrumentalist Ed Motta is a popular artist with the soul of a jazz musician. He makes light, seemingly effortless music that connects with musicians and jazz fans at a profound level, through artistry, musicianship and an engaging personality.

His work covers many genres utilising influences from jazz to popular Brazilian music, rock to Hollywood film soundtracks, funk, classical, bossa nova and reggae.

Tonight Ed, backed by his stellar band,  plays from his substantial back catalogue and  showcases music from his latest release AOR, an outrageously accurate tribute to the super-smooth, musicianly ‘Yacht Rock’ of the late 1970s (Steely Dan, Doobie Brothers, etc.)

Ed has played with names such as Roy Ayers, Chucho Valdés, Jean-Paul “Bluey” Maunick, Ryuichi Sakamoto, Paul Griffin, Bernard Purdie, Bo Diddley, Ed Lincoln, Mondo Grosso, Marcos Valle, João Donato and Dom Salvador, among many others.

“Absolutely Sublime” The Independent on Sunday

“Ed Motta is the Don!” Gilles Peterson

“Maybe the UK is finally ready for this Brazilian giant.” John L Walters

Ed Motta is also on a La Linea tour:
Band on the Wall, Manchester April 3; The Sage Gateshead, April 4; The Wardrobe, Leeds April 5; Turner Sims, Southampton April 8 and more tbc

266259366865647.description:
All female Japanese legends Shonen Knife return to London 'Rock City' & Dingwalls in May 2014 with their 20th album "Overdrive", released April 14 on Damnably

Formed in Osaka almost 33 years ago, the trio rose from humble DIY beginnings to touring with Nirvana on their ‘Nevermind’ tour, trailblazing a path for women in music and inspiring legions of bands. Championed by Nirvana, Sonic Youth and hailed as a favourite by the crème-de-la-crème of Alternative Rock, Shonen Knife remain one of the most influential and beloved of Japanese rock exports.
Following an extensive tour of Europe in 2013, the band return will for 15 dates across the UK and Ireland this May before heading to Europe, to promote the release of their 20th album, Overdrive.
Live, they are a tight with machine-precision, punching out fast, highly exciting sets of Punk, Pop, Rock & Metal hits, all coated with their own distinctively quirky and life-affirming charm. As they fast approach their 1,000th gig, Shonen Knife's joy and invention shows no sign of fading. As Naoko says, “Let's Rock!”


"When I finally got to see them live, I was transformed into a hysterical nine-year-old girl at a Beatles concert." Kurt Cobain.

Press :
Uncut: "rocks like Motorhead designed by Hanna-Barbara"
BBC Music: "The Osaka Ramones, you must concede, still have it."
The Independent: 8/10 "There are two types of people: those who enjoy thrashy Japanese girl-punk, and those who have something wrong with them."
Music OMH: 8/10 "For an incredible 31 years Shonen Knife have been pumping out prototype riot grrrl, thrashing together early punk sounds with pop melodies."
The Sunday Times: ".irrepressible slice of bounce-along indie-pop. Beguiling." Stewart Lee
Artrocker:"Objectively, it could be pointed out that they can only play in a rudimentary fashion, that their songs are ludicrously simple and that they are not doing anything new. Objectivity can fuck right off, because Shonen Knife are brilliant"
The Line Of Best Fit: 7/10 "Robust in its eccentricities and musicianship, Pop Tune makes good on Yamano's assertion that the current Shonen Knife line-up is its strongest."
The Skinny: 8/10 "Pop Tune is their most irresistible offering in years"
Louder Than War:"As the world continues to go into economic meltdown we need the distraction of Shonen Knife more than ever - just allow yourself the simple pleasure of singing along."
Clash: "Ultimately, without using superlatives, Shonen Knife should be set up for life as ambassadors for live music."
BBC 6Music (Steve Lamacq):"Shonen Knife - they know how to rock - Japanese punk pop at its best."

Advance tickets available from WeGotTickets Gigantic Tickets SEE Tickets and TicketWeb UK fro £12.50 or £15 on the door

Links

Shonen Knife Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ShonenKnifeOfficial
Shonen Knife Twitter: https://twitter.com/ShonenKnife
Damnably: http://www.damnably.com@

271628536333045.description:
"I AM WOMAN, HEAR ME ROAR"
★★★★ Scotsman, List, Herald, Skinny
★★★★★ BritishTheatreGuide, Examiner, BroadwayBaby, ThreeWeeks, Fringe Review, Exeunt, Examiner

Header photo by Guido Harari.

In Cristian Ceresoli's critically acclaimed and angry play, a ‘young’, ‘ugly’ and literally naked Silvia Gallerano captivatingly reveals her revolting secrets, as she struggles with obstinacy, resistance and courage for her own celebrity breakthrough in the society of Thighs and Liberty.

Winner of six major awards, including the coveted Scotsman Fringe First Award and the Stage Award for Best Actress, La Merda caused a sensation on its 2012 Edinburgh Fringe World Premiere, returning in 2013 for a sell-out Fringe run and successful European tour.

"If you are too fragile for the experience of being shouted at for an hour by a beautiful stark-naked Italian woman – this is probably not for you. Devastating stream of counsciousness. One of the most wonderfully full-on performances ever seen at the Edinburgh Festival" Joyce McMillan, Scotsman

‘A piece so literally and metaphorically naked, raw and angry that you leave the theatre feeling as if you’ve had all your skin scraped off.’ Lyn Gardner, The Guardian

‘Raw, touching, intelligent and mesmerising ... an unforgettable piece of theatre
that reveals our universal inner thoughts, fears, desires and memory with almost frightening accuracy ... Brash, brutal, beastly, yet beautiful ... a near-perfect recreation of humanity, and indeed, society at its most powerful, most desperate, most vulnerable and most cutting.’ Amy Taylor, The List

‘Utterly compelling verbal symphony. Somewhat perversely, the compelling honesty of what follows is simply irresistible.’ The Herald

‘Lots of awards for the revolutionary monologue.’ Il Sole 24 Ore

‘A howl of sorrow, an incitement to free our country.’ L’Unità

‘The rage is nude.’ Vogue ‘Pasolinean Rage, sublime acting.’ Radio 3

 ‘Shocking monologue in the dying country.’ Corriere della Sera

Silvia Gallerano is superb’ La Repubblica‘ 

You’ll leave feeling Italy’s anger in your bones.’ The Stage

‘Acclaimed opera of Cristian Ceresoli ... excellent writing with a Shakespearean aftertaste and a Pasolinean fil rouge.’ Il Fatto Quotidiano

‘Truly shocking and brilliant.’ British Theatre Guide

‘Often irritating, disgusting and politically incorrect, yet so human, so terribly human to deserve a massive and touching standing ovation‘ La Provincia di Cremona

‘A gem. Sixty minutes of amazing show where, and it is synonymous of excellence, you struggle to paying compliments primarily for writing or interpretation.’
Il Giorno

'The audience feels pinned back in our seats with the full force of the words" The Skinny

‘This is skin in the tradition of Artaud and it is powerful, political and poetic.’ Examiner
271628536333045.name: LA MERDA IN LONDON, WEST END 15Apr-4May

274286046068167.description:
YOU WERE AMAZING!!!
Please check us out on KICKSTARTER at https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/110577683/sound-asleep-a-comedy-film-about-insomnia-top-up-f - 

YOUR SUPPORT MEANS THE WORLD TO US.

PHOTOS & VIDEOS OF THE DAY

Please upload to our wall at www.facebook.com/SoundAsleepFilm

You can see the Sound Asleep Team's photos at https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.487226524736706.1073741839.305330386259655&type=3

And all the photos your fellow pillowfighters at https://www.facebook.com/SoundAsleepFilm?sk=wall&filter=2&notif_t=wall

Post your Youtube Videos to our wall and we'll add them to our official Youtube Playlist at http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2wLjH33TVf3CrVJLDkq4uhNJpnnh8kIP


















----
Scroll Down For The Rules
----
1 day to go!

Like Sound Asleep at www.facebook.com/soundasleepfilm for latest info on the event, prizes, competitions and a chance to be in our movie. 

Why are Sound Asleep spreading the word about pillow fight day? 

We are making a movie about pillows, bed time and insomnia. We'll shoot some scenes for the film at the pillow fight - you could be in the movie!. Spread the word about us and in return we'll keep bringing you madness like this. 

----
PHOTOS AND VIDEOS:

Post your photos and videos to our facebook page and we will share them all to everyone who attended. 

Tweets: Use the #soundasleeppillowfight hastag and we'll add your videos to our official youtube playlist, and retweet your photos.

Playlist: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2wLjH33TVf3CrVJLDkq4uhNJpnnh8kIP

----
PILLOW FIGHT RULES


WAIT FOR THE SIGNAL  -  BARKING BATTERIA SAMBA BAND and SOUND ASLEEP will count the event in. Wait till you hear "READY, TEDDY, GO!" - Then the Band will go for it, and so should you!


**PLEASE PLAY NICE! NO ONE WANTS TO GET HURT**

1. Wear something that says bedtime: 
PYJAMAS, Dressing Gown, Onesie. And take your glasses off.

2. Bring a pillow. 
And keep it HIDDEN till we start at 3pm. (LISTEN FOR THE SAMBA BAND)

Using foam pillows or pillow slips will help reduce mess.  

No cushions and don't over fill or harden your pillow. Soft and fluffy is just right. This is just for fun!

3. Play nice - don't pick on anyone much smaller than you, don't hit anyone too hard.

4. Only pillow fight with people holding pillows. If someone looks unhappy help them away from the action.

5. If you have allergies to feathers make sure to take your anti-hystamines.

6. Don't hit anyone holding a camera.

7. Please bring a plastic or BIN BAG. If we each CLEAN UP THE MESS of one pillow, maybe they'll let us do it again next year. 

8. Updates on the day from Sound Asleep on facebook - 
www.facebook.com/SoundAsleepFilm 
and on twitter: 
www.twitter.com/SoundAsleepFilm - #soundasleeppillowfight 

9. Share your photos and videos on the sound asleep facebook page. We all want to see those amazing photos afterwards and we'll be running our photo competitions for photos shared at www.facebook.com/SoundAsleepFilm


Sound Asleep did not set this up, in fact we have no idea who did!   We just like to spread the word.

-----
UPDATE:

Timeout are reporting that the Mayor's office have warned that there will be some maintenance on the square on the day. We cannot comment on the authenticity of the reports but suspect they are keen to reduce numbers. It's up to you if you attend. This is not Sound Asleep's event to cancel, it is yours. We will continue to spread the messages that we believe encourage this event to go off in a safe, responsible and light hearted way. 

Please clean up after yourselves.
Please don't fight too hard and don't risk hurting anyone.
274286046068167.name: Sound Asleep at the World Record Attempt Pillow Fight London

He loved playing for us last time and couldn't wait to come back and when we got asked wether we would like to book him we couldn't  really say no to a DJ who starts his set with Wu Tang's "36 Chambers" and finishes off with some heavy techno.

South London Ordnance has been someone who we have kept a very keen eye on and with a run of releases on labels such as Hotflush, Aery Metals and Warp he has established himself as a massive force within the electronic music scene and 2014 is looking set to be his biggest year.
